episodes.title: Simpsons Roasting on an Open Fire
episodes.description: Homer decides to gamble on a "hunch" at the dog track when his annual Christmas bonus is canceled.

episodes.title: Bart The Genius
episodes.description: Bart is believed to be a genius after he switches I.Q. tests with brainy Martin Prince.

episodes.title: Homer's Odyssey
episodes.description: Fired from his job at the Nuclear Power Plant, Homer decides to embark on a campaign to make all of Springfield safer.

episodes.title: There's No Disgrace Like Home
episodes.description: After attending the annual company picnic, Homer becomes jealous of fellow employees with 'normal' families.  He decides to enlist the aid of psychologist Marvin Monroe to treat his wife and children.

episodes.title: Bart the General
episodes.description: Grandpa Simpson aids Bart in his war against a school bully and his gang.

episodes.title: Moaning Lisa
episodes.description: Lisa befriends a saxophone player when she develops a case of the blues.

episodes.title: The Call of the Simpsons
episodes.description: Homer is mistaken for Bigfoot when he takes his family on a trip into the wilderness in their new camper.

episodes.title: The Telltale Head
episodes.description: Bart attempts to impress his new friends by vandalizing a statue of the town's founding father, Jebediah Springfield.

episodes.title: Life on the Fast Lane
episodes.description: Marge contemplates having an affair with a local womanizer after Homer selfishly buys her a bowling ball for her birthday.

episodes.title: Homer's Night Out
episodes.description: Bart photographs Homer with belly-dancer Princess Kashmir.  Marge will only forgive her husband when he proves to Bart that all women are not merely sexual objects.

episodes.title: The Crepes of Wrath
episodes.description: To Homer's delight, Bart is sent to France for the summer as part of a student exchange program.

episodes.title: Krusty Gets Busted
episodes.description: When Homer positively identifies Krusty the Clown as an armed robber, Bart attempts to clear his idol's name.

episodes.title: Some Enchanted Evening
episodes.description: Marge and Homer unwittingly leave their children in the care of a villainous babysitter when they attempt to rekindle their marriage.

episodes.title: Bart Gets an F
episodes.description: Bart must pass a critical history test or he will be held back a grade.

episodes.title: Simpson and Delilah
episodes.description: Homer's life changes dramatically when he purchases a miracle hair growth formula.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror
episodes.description: The Simpsons tell three bloodcurdling tales of horror on Halloween night.

episodes.title: Two Cars in Every Garage and Three Eyes on Every Fish
episodes.description: Homer supports Mr. Burns in his bid for governor, but Marge remains loyal to Burns's political opposition.

episodes.title: Dancin' Homer
episodes.description: Homer becomes the official mascot for a major league baseball team.

episodes.title: Dead Putting Society
episodes.description: Homer and Ned Flanders pressure their sons to win a miniature golf championship.

episodes.title: Bart vs. Thanksgiving
episodes.description: Bart learns the true meaning of Thanksgiving when he runs away from home after having an argument with Lisa.

episodes.title: Bart the Daredevil
episodes.description: Bart is determined to leap a gorge on his skateboard after witnessing the death defying stunts of a real daredevil.

episodes.title: Itchy and Scratchy and Marge
episodes.description: Marge initiates a protest movement against gratuitous violence on television when Maggie begins acting aggressively after viewing Itchy and Scratchy cartoons.

episodes.title: Bart Gets Hit by a Car
episodes.description: When Mr. Burns hits Bart with his car, Homer is enticed by a disreputable lawyer to sue him.

episodes.title: One Fish, Two Fish, Blowfish, Blue Fish
episodes.description: Homer believes he has only twenty-four hours to live after he eats an improperly prepared blowfish.

episodes.title: The Way We Was
episodes.description: Marge recounts to her children how she and Homer first met and fell in love.

episodes.title: Homer vs. Lisa and the 8th Commandment
episodes.description: Lisa disapproves when Homer has cable television installed illegally into their home.

episodes.title: Principal Charming
episodes.description: Homer arranges a date between Principal Skinner and Marge's sister, Selma.

episodes.title: Oh Brother, Where Art Thou?
episodes.description: Homer locates his long lost half brother Herb and discovers that he is rich.

episodes.title: Bart's Dog Gets an F
episodes.description: Bart must help train Santa's Little Helper to pass an obedience course or Homer will give the dog away.

episodes.title: Old Money
episodes.description: Grampa Simpson falls in love... and inherits a fortune.

episodes.title: Brush with Greatness
episodes.description: Marge renews her interest in becoming an artist after Homer finds an old painting of Ringo Starr in the attic.  Mr. Burns commissions Marge to paint a portrait of him.

episodes.title: Lisa's Substitute
episodes.description: Lisa develops a crush on her substitute teacher, Mr. Bergstrom.  Bergstrom tells Homer he must learn to act as a positive role model for his daughter.

episodes.title: The War of the Simpsons
episodes.description: Marge insists Homer accompany her for a weekend of marriage counseling at a wooded retreat, but Homer takes advantage of the location to attempt to catch a legendary catfish.

episodes.title: Three Men and a Comic Book
episodes.description: Bart and his friends pool their money to purchase the first issue of "Radioactive Man" comics, but then cannot decide who gets to keep it.

episodes.title: Blood Feud
episodes.description: Homer expects a generous gift in return when he donates Bart's blood to an ailing Mr. Burns.

episodes.title: Stark Raving Dad
episodes.description: Homer is institutionalized after Bart fills out his sanity test.  A man who thinks he is Michael Jackson helps Bart write a song for Lisa when he forgets her birthday.

episodes.title: Mr. Lisa Goes to Washington
episodes.description: The Simpsons travel to the Nation's Capitol when Lisa becomes a semifinalist in an essay contest on patriotism.

episodes.title: When Flanders Failed
episodes.description: Ned Flanders opens a store for left-handed people and Homer is overjoyed when it performs poorly.

episodes.title: Bart the Murderer
episodes.description: Bart fraternizes with a gang of mobsters and becomes the prime suspect when Principal Skinner mysteriously disappears.

episodes.title: Homer Defined
episodes.description: Homer becomes a hero when he averts a catastrophe at the power plant, but what is perceived as his skill of being a quick thinker is actually dumb luck.

episodes.title: Like Father, Like Clown
episodes.description: Bart and Lisa scheme to reunite Krusty the Clown with his father, Rabbi Krustofsky, who disowned him for not carrying on the family tradition.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror II
episodes.description: The Simpsons eat too much candy on Halloween and experience nightmarish tales of horror while they sleep.

episodes.title: Lisa's Pony
episodes.description: Homer realizes that he never shows Lisa the attention she deserves and buys her a pony.

episodes.title: Saturdays of Thunder
episodes.description: Realizing he has not been a good father to Bart, Homer aids his son in building a soap box racer.

episodes.title: Flaming Moe's
episodes.description: Homer gives Moe the recipe for a unique alcoholic drink, and when it turns into a sensation, Moe takes credit, and the profits, from its success.

episodes.title: Burns Verkaufen der Kraftwerk
episodes.description: Homer is fired from his job when a German firm buys the power plant from Mr. Burns.

episodes.title: I Married Marge
episodes.description: When Marge believes she may be pregnant, Homer recounts how Bart was born.

episodes.title: Radio Bart
episodes.description: Using his Superstar Celebrity microphone, Bart tricks all of Springfield into believing that a child has fallen down a well.  But when he falls into the same well, Bart cannot get anyone to save him.

episodes.title: Lisa the Greek
episodes.description: Lisa accurately predicts the winners of sporting events that Homer gambles on so she can be closer to her father.

episodes.title: Homer Alone
episodes.description: When Marge reaches the breaking point, she leaves for a much needed vacation, leaving the rest of the family to realize how much she does for them.

episodes.title: Bart the Lover
episodes.description: When Bart discovers that his divorced teacher, Mrs. Krabappel, has placed a "personals" ad in the local newspaper, he decides to create fake correspondence.

episodes.title: Homer at the Bat
episodes.description: Mr. Burns bets one million dollars that his power plant's softball team will win the championship, then hires professional baseball players to be members of the team.

episodes.title: Separate Vocations
episodes.description: Bart finds new respect for the law and Lisa hangs out with the wrong crowd after they both take career aptitude tests.

episodes.title: Dog of Death
episodes.description: The Simpsons must choose between frills and their dog when Santa's Little Helper needs an expensive operation to save its life.

episodes.title: Colonel Homer
episodes.description: Homer becomes the manager of a beautiful Country Western singer.

episodes.title: Black Widower
episodes.description: To Bart's horror, Selma announces that her husband-to-be is none other than Sideshow Bob.

episodes.title: The Otto Show
episodes.description: Bart attends a Spinal Tap concert.  Otto loses his job driving the school bus and moves in with the Simpsons.

episodes.title: Bart's Friend Falls in Love
episodes.description: Bart becomes jealous when Milhouse falls for a girl who transferred to their school.

episodes.title: Brother, Can You Spare Two Dimes?
episodes.description: Herb Powell asks his brother Homer to let him borrow $2000 to develop a new invention: a translator of baby gibberish.

episodes.title: Kamp Krusty
episodes.description: Bart and Lisa are horrified when their summer at Kamp Krusty turns into a nightmare.

episodes.title: A Streetcar Named Marge
episodes.description: When Marge lands the role of Blanche in a local production of "A Streetcar Named Desire," Homer cannot hide his disinterest.

episodes.title: Homer the Heretic
episodes.description: Homer creates his own religion as a means of escaping church services on Sundays.

episodes.title: Lisa the Beauty Queen
episodes.description: Homer enters Lisa in a beauty pageant when her self-esteem plummets.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror III
episodes.description: During a Halloween party, the Simpsons tell three horrifying tales of the macabre.

episodes.title: Itchy and Scratchy: The Movie
episodes.description: Homer forbids his son from seeing a new movie about his favorite cartoon heroes as punishment for misbehaving.

episodes.title: Marge Gets a Job
episodes.description: When the foundation to the Simpsons' house is need of an expensive repair, Marge takes a position at the power plant where Homer works.

episodes.title: New Kid on the Block
episodes.description: Bart falls in love with the girl who moves in next door, only to find that she prefers the school bully.

episodes.title: Mr. Plow
episodes.description: Homer and Barney vie for Springfield's lucrative snow plowing business.

episodes.title: Lisa's First Word
episodes.description: Marge recounts how Lisa first spoke as the family awaits baby Maggie's first word.

episodes.title: Homer's Triple Bypass
episodes.description: Homer suffers a heart attack and hires Dr. Nick Riviera to perform a delicate triple bypass operation.

episodes.title: Marge vs. the Monorail
episodes.description: An unscrupulous profiteer sells the people of Springfield on a defective monorail system, with Homer as the conductor.

episodes.title: Selma's Choice
episodes.description: Selma decides to take her dead aunt's advice and have children before it is too late.

episodes.title: Brother from the Same Planet
episodes.description: Bart tires of Homer's lack of interest in him and chooses another father from the Bigger Brother program.  Lisa struggles to kick the habit of dialing a 900 number.

episodes.title: I Love Lisa
episodes.description: Lisa feels pity for Ralph, a nerdy classmate, and gives him a card on Valentine's Day. But to her horror, Ralph develops a crush on her.

episodes.title: Duffless
episodes.description: Marge convinces Homer he may have a drinking problem. Lisa plots to humiliate Bart with her science project after he ruins an experiment.

episodes.title: Last Exit to Springfield
episodes.description: Homer is elected union leader at the power plant and tries to save the dental plan so he will not have to pay for Lisa's new braces.

episodes.title: So It's Come to This: A Simpsons Clip Show
episodes.description: Family and friends reminisce about Homer's life after Bart's April Fools' Day prank sends him to the hospital.

episodes.title: The Front
episodes.description: Using Grandpa as a front, Lisa and Bart write their own "Itchy and Scratchy" cartoons.

episodes.title: Whacking Day
episodes.description: Lisa seeks to end a local holiday in which snakes are chased into town and beaten with sticks.  Bart is expelled from school by Principal Skinner.

episodes.title: Marge in Chains
episodes.description: Marge is jailed when she is convicted of stealing from Apu's convenience store.

episodes.title: Krusty Gets Kancelled
episodes.description: Bart, Lisa and a group of celebrities help Krusty turn his career around after his television show is canceled.

episodes.title: Homer's Barbershop Quartet
episodes.description: Homer recounts his phenomenal rise to superstardom as a member of the barbershop quartet, The Be Sharps.

episodes.title: Cape Feare
episodes.description: Sideshow Bob terrorizes Bart after he is paroled from prison.

episodes.title: Homer Goes to College
episodes.description: Homer enrolls in a nuclear physics class at Springfield University and convinces three nerdy classmates to help him pull off a prank.

episodes.title: Rosebud
episodes.description: The Simpsons find Mr. Burns' long-lost childhood teddy bear.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror IV
episodes.description: In a ghoulish gallery, Bart hosts three bloodcurdling tales of Halloween horror.

episodes.title: Marge on the Lam
episodes.description: Marge joins divorcee Ruth Powers for a wild night on the town, only to discover that her friend is driving a stolen vehicle.

episodes.title: Bart's Inner Child
episodes.description: The host of a self-help workshop convinces the people of Springfield they should emulate Bart's uninhibited personality.

episodes.title: Boy-Scoutz 'N the Hood
episodes.description: Bart inadvertently joins the Junior Campers, and during a rafting trip, he becomes lost at sea with Homer and Ned Flanders.

episodes.title: The Last Temptation of Homer
episodes.description: Homer is attracted to a sexy co-worker with a personality identical to his own.

episodes.title: $pringfield (Or, How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love Legalized Gambling)
episodes.description: Marge becomes addicted to playing slot machines after the town of Springfield legalizes gambling.

episodes.title: Homer the Vigilante
episodes.description: Homer takes the law into his own hands after Springfield is victimized by a cat burglar.

episodes.title: Bart Gets Famous
episodes.description: Bart becomes an instant celebrity after he ad-libs a line during a sketch on the "Krusty the Klown Show."

episodes.title: Homer and Apu
episodes.description: Apu offers the Simpsons his services as valet after he is fired from the Kwik-E-Mart for selling rancid meat.

episodes.title: Lisa vs. Malibu Stacy
episodes.description: Lisa manufactures her own talking doll for little girls.

episodes.title: Deep Space Homer
episodes.description: NASA scientists train Homer to become the first average American in space, with near disastrous results.

episodes.title: Homer Loves Flanders
episodes.description: Flanders is horrified to discover he has become Homer's best friend.

episodes.title: Bart Gets an Elephant
episodes.description: Bart wins a full grown African elephant as part of a radio contest.

episodes.title: Burns' Heir
episodes.description: Mr. Burns chooses Bart as the heir to his vast fortune.

episodes.title: Sweet Seymour Skinner's Baadasssss Song
episodes.description: Bart suffers enormous guilt after Skinner is fired from his job as school principal.

episodes.title: The Boy Who Knew Too Much
episodes.description: Only Bart can clear Mayor Quimby's nephew of an assault charge, but he fears that identifying himself as a witness will mean expulsion for skipping class.

episodes.title: Lady Bouvier's Lover
episodes.description: Grampa and Mr. Burns vie for Mrs. Bouvier's hand in marriage.  Bart purchases a worthless Itchy and Scratchy animation cell.

episodes.title: Secrets of a Successful Marriage
episodes.description: Marge kicks Homer out of the house after she discovers that he revealed her personal secrets to an adult education class.

episodes.title: Bart of Darkness
episodes.description: Bart believes he witnessed Ned Flanders murder his wife.  Lisa's popularity soars after her family buys a swimming pool during a heat wave.

episodes.title: Lisa's Rival
episodes.description: Lisa becomes jealous when she meets a new student who is even more intelligent than herself.  Homer acquires a truckload of white sugar, thinking it will net him a fortune.

episodes.title: Another Simpsons Clip Show
episodes.description: When Marge suspects that romance has gone out of her life, her family recalls romantic encounters from their past.

episodes.title: Itchy and Scratchy Land
episodes.description: The Simpsons visit a theme park based on the gratuitously violent Itchy and Scratchy cartoons.

episodes.title: Sideshow Bob Roberts
episodes.description: Sideshow Bob runs for political office after Mayor Quimby pardons him from prison.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror V
episodes.description: The Simpsons spin three tales of Halloween horror.

episodes.title: Bart's Girlfriend
episodes.description: Bart falls in love with Reverend Lovejoy's beautiful daughter, only to discover that she is more of a hellion than he is.

episodes.title: Lisa on Ice
episodes.description: Lisa joins a hockey team and finds herself pitted against Bart in a critical game.

episodes.title: Homer Badman
episodes.description: Homer is wrongly accused of committing sexual harassment.

episodes.title: Grampa vs. Sexual Inadequacy
episodes.description: While selling a homemade tonic guaranteed to increase sexual desire in men, Grampa reveals that Homer's conception was accidental.

episodes.title: Fear of Flying
episodes.description: Marge seeks professional help from a psychiatrist after realizing she is afraid to fly.

episodes.title: Homer the Great
episodes.description: Homer's popularity skyrockets when he is chosen as the leader of a secret organization.

episodes.title: And Maggie Makes Three
episodes.description: Homer recounts how Maggie's accidental birth changed his life forever.

episodes.title: Bart's Comet
episodes.description: Bart discovers a comet that is on a collision course with Springfield.

episodes.title: Homie the Clown
episodes.description: Homer enrolls in a clown college franchised by Krusty the Clown.

episodes.title: Bart vs. Australia
episodes.description: Bart must apologize to the country of Australia after he tricks a boy from down under into accepting an expensive collect call.

episodes.title: Homer vs. Patty and Selma
episodes.description: Homer is forced to borrow money from Patty and Selma after he wipes out the family's savings by investing in pumpkins.

episodes.title: A Star Is Burns
episodes.description: Homer grows jealous after Marge asks critic Jay Sherman to co-judge Springfield's film festival.

episodes.title: Lisa's Wedding
episodes.description: A fortune teller describes how a genteel Englishman will ask for Lisa's hand in marriage in the year 2010.

episodes.title: Two Dozen and One Greyhounds
episodes.description: Bart and Lisa attempt to rescue 25 greyhound puppies from Mr. Burns, who wants to use their hides for a new tuxedo.

episodes.title: The PTA Disbands
episodes.description: Bart masterminds a teacher's strike, but is humiliated when Marge takes charge of his class.

episodes.title: 'Round Springfield
episodes.description: Lisa is saddened by the death of blues great Bleeding Gums Murphy.  Bart ingests a piece of jagged metal while eating Krusty-O cereal.

episodes.title: The Springfield Connection
episodes.description: Marge joins the police force.

episodes.title: Lemon of Troy
episodes.description: Bart and his friends march on Shelbyville when Springfield's lemon tree is stolen by a gang of children from across the border.

episodes.title: Who Shot Mr. Burns? (Part One)
episodes.description: Just about everyone in Springfield vows to kill Mr. Burns after he cheats the elementary school out of a newly discovered oil well and threatens to block out the sun.

episodes.title: Who Shot Mr. Burns? (Part Two)
episodes.description: Lisa aids police with the investigation of the Burns shooting.

episodes.title: Radioactive Man
episodes.description: Hollywood producers cast Milhouse in a motion picture based on the popular "Radioactive Man" comic books.

episodes.title: Home Sweet Homediddly-Dum-Doodily
episodes.description: The Flanders gain custody of the Simpson children after welfare workers accuse Homer and Marge of being negligent parents.

episodes.title: Bart Sells His Soul
episodes.description: Bart sells his soul to Milhouse for five dollars.  Moe transforms his bar into a family restaurant.

episodes.title: Lisa the Vegetarian
episodes.description: Lisa turns vegetarian after her family visits a petting zoo.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror VI
episodes.description: The Simpsons appear in three horrifying Halloween tales.

episodes.title: King-Size Homer
episodes.description: Homer intentionally gains weight so he can qualify for disability and work at home.

episodes.title: Mother Simpson
episodes.description: After Homer fakes his own death, his long-thought-deceased mother arrives in Springfield to pay her last respects.

episodes.title: Sideshow Bob's Last Gleaming
episodes.description: Sideshow Bob threatens to detonate a nuclear bomb unless television is abolished.

episodes.title: The Simpsons 138th Episode Spectacular
episodes.description: Troy McClure hosts this special 138th episode, which includes the first-ever cartoon shorts, trivia questions, and never-before-seen footage.

episodes.title: Marge Be Not Proud
episodes.description: As Christmas approaches, Marge treats Bart like an adult after he is caught shoplifting.

episodes.title: Team Homer
episodes.description: Homer reluctantly accepts Mr. Burns into his new bowling league.  Bart causes a student riot by wearing a Mad magazine iron-on prompting Skinner to implement a school dress code.

episodes.title: Two Bad Neighbors
episodes.description: Former President George Bush and his wife Barbara buy a house across the street from the Simpsons.

episodes.title: Scenes from the Class Struggle in Springfield
episodes.description: The Simpsons apply for membership at a posh country club.

episodes.title: Bart the Fink
episodes.description: Krusty is arrested for massive tax fraud after Bart inadvertently exposes his hero's illegal bank account.

episodes.title: Lisa the Iconoclast
episodes.description: Lisa discovers that Jebediah Springfield was a vicious pirate. Homer wins the coveted role of town crier in an upcoming parade.

episodes.title: Homer the Smithers
episodes.description: Homer acts as Mr. Burns' assistant while Smithers is away on vacation.

episodes.title: The Day the Violence Died
episodes.description: Bart and Lisa come to the aid of a down-and-out man who claims to have invented the concept of cartoon violence.

episodes.title: A Fish Called Selma
episodes.description: Troy McClure stages a Hollywood comeback when he begins dating Selma.

episodes.title: Bart on the Road
episodes.description: Using a fake driver's license, Bart rents a car and embarks on a Spring Break road trip with his friends.  A special bond develops between Lisa and Homer after Skinner invents Go To Work With Your Parents Day.

episodes.title: 22 Short Films About Springfield
episodes.description: The lives of Springfield residents are highlighted in a series of interconnecting vignettes.

episodes.title: Raging Abe Simpson and His Grumbling Grandson in 'The Curse of the Flying Hellfish'
episodes.description: Grampa and Mr. Burns, the last surviving members of a World War II army unit, vie for a priceless collection of rare art hidden in a secret location.

episodes.title: Much Apu About Nothing
episodes.description: Apu faces deportation when a referendum on illegal immigrants is placed on the Springfield ballot.

episodes.title: Homerpalooza
episodes.description: Homer is hired to perform in a rock festival.

episodes.title: Summer of 4 Ft. 2
episodes.description: While on summer vacation with her family, Lisa sheds her nerdy image in an effort to make new friends.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror VII
episodes.description: The Simpsons appear in three tales of terror: Bart discovers an evil twin brother living in the attic; Lisa creates a microscopic society; and space aliens transform themselves into Clinton and Dole look-alikes.

episodes.title: You Only Move Twice
episodes.description: The Simpsons relocate to another community after Homer unwittingly takes a job with a company controlled by a super-villain.

episodes.title: The Homer They Fall
episodes.description: Homer becomes a professional boxer when doctors discover he was born with a unique genetic condition that protects his brain from injury.

episodes.title: Burns, Baby Burns
episodes.description: With Homer's help, Mr. Burns' long-lost son stages his own kidnapping.

episodes.title: Bart After Dark
episodes.description: While Marge is out of town, Homer allows Bart to work at a burlesque house.

episodes.title: A Milhouse Divided
episodes.description: When Milhouse's parents get a divorce, Homer grows convinced that his own marriage is in jeopardy.

episodes.title: Lisa's Date with Density
episodes.description: Lisa develops a crush on bully Nelson Muntz.  Homer uses an automatic telephone dialer for an electronic panhandling scheme.

episodes.title: Hurricane Neddy
episodes.description: Ned Flanders suffers a breakdown after his home is destroyed by a hurricane.

episodes.title: El Viaje Misterioso de Nuestro Jomer (The Mysterious Voyage of Homer)
episodes.description: After ingesting several Guatemalan peppers during chili cook-off, Homer experiences hallucinatory visions that inspire him to find his true soul mate in life.

episodes.title: The Springfield Files
episodes.description: X-Files Agents Mulder and Scully investigate Homer's encounter with an alleged extraterrestrial.

episodes.title: The Twisted World of Marge Simpson
episodes.description: After being expelled from an investment club, Marge starts her own pretzel franchise.

episodes.title: Mountain of Madness
episodes.description: Homer and Mr. Burns are buried beneath an avalanche during a survival trek in the mountains.

episodes.title: Simpsoncalifragilisticexpiala(Annoyed Grunt)cious
episodes.description: The Simpsons hire a Mary Poppins-like nanny when Marge becomes overwhelmed by the demands of being a housewife.

episodes.title: The Itchy and Scratchy and Poochie Show
episodes.description: When ratings for Itchy & Scratchy cartoons plummet, a studio committee creates a new, hipper character and hires Homer to provide the voice. Presented by FXX.

episodes.title: Homer's Phobia
episodes.description: Homer grows homophobic after he realizes the family's new friend is gay.

episodes.title: Brother from Another Series
episodes.description: Bart fears the worst when Sideshow Bob wins release from prison by claiming he is a reformed man and is hired by his brother to work on a construction project.

episodes.title: My Sister, My Sitter
episodes.description: Homer and Marge allow Lisa to baby-sit Bart.

episodes.title: Homer vs. the Eighteenth Amendment
episodes.description: Homer turns bootlegger when Springfield enforces an antiquated prohibition law.

episodes.title: Grade School Confidential
episodes.description: Bart exposes Skinner and Krabappel's clandestine affair.

episodes.title: The Canine Mutiny
episodes.description: Bart gives away Santa's Little Helper so he can keep a fully trained, blue ribbon Collie.

episodes.title: The Old Man and the Lisa
episodes.description: Lisa helps Mr. Burns build a recycling center after a series of bad investments costs the multimillionaire his fortune.

episodes.title: In Marge We Trust
episodes.description: Marge becomes a church volunteer.  Homer discovers his image printed on a box of Japanese dish detergent.

episodes.title: Homer's Enemy
episodes.description: A resentful, hard-working employee at the power plant makes Homer his enemy.  Bart purchases an abandoned factory for one dollar at a government auction.

episodes.title: The Simpsons Spin-Off Showcase
episodes.description: Troy McClure hosts three spin-offs from "The Simpsons" television show.

episodes.title: The Secret War of Lisa Simpson
episodes.description: Cadets give Lisa the "silent treatment" when she enrolls in an all-male military academy.

episodes.title: The City of New York vs. Homer Simpson
episodes.description: The Simpsons journey to New York City to retrieve the family car.

episodes.title: The Principal and the Pauper
episodes.description: A stranger claims that Principal Skinner is an impostor.

episodes.title: Lisa's Sax
episodes.description: Homer and Marge recount how Lisa got her saxophone.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror VIII
episodes.description: Homer battles killer mutants after Springfield is destroyed by a nuclear blast; a matter- transportation device melds Bart with a housefly; in Colonial times, Marge is accused of being a witch.

episodes.title: The Cartridge Family
episodes.description: Homer purchases a handgun to protect his family.

episodes.title: Bart Star
episodes.description: Homer becomes coach of the Springfield Pee Wee Football team and appoints Bart as starting quarterback.

episodes.title: The Two Mrs. Nahasapeemapetilons
episodes.description: In an effort to annul an arranged marriage, Apu tells his mother he wed Marge.

episodes.title: Lisa the Skeptic
episodes.description: Townspeople believe Lisa has unearthed the fossilized remains of an angel.

episodes.title: Realty Bites
episodes.description: Marge gets a job with a realty firm, but her honesty costs her lucrative sales.  Homer purchases a 60s hot-rod convertible at a police auction.

episodes.title: Miracle on Evergreen Terrace
episodes.description: People throughout Springfield open their hearts and wallets after Bart claims the family's Christmas presents were stolen by a burglar.

episodes.title: All Singing, All Dancing
episodes.description: The Simpsons recall their many musical moments from seasons past.

episodes.title: Bart Carny
episodes.description: A carnival worker and his son move in with the Simpsons after Homer costs them their jobs.

episodes.title: The Joy of Sect
episodes.description: Marge tries her hand at deprogramming after her family is brainwashed by a religious cult.

episodes.title: Das Bus
episodes.description: Bart, Lisa and their classmates fight for survival when they become stranded on a remote island.  Homer starts his own business on the Internet.

episodes.title: The Last Temptation of Krusty
episodes.description: Krusty shuns his old routines in favor of edgier material and suddenly becomes the hottest comic in show business.

episodes.title: Dumbbell Indemnity
episodes.description: When Moe goes broke romancing his new love, he enlists Homer in a scheme to collect on an insurance policy.

episodes.title: Lisa the Simpson
episodes.description: Lisa fears she is genetically predisposed to lose her intelligence. Apu uses a frozen Jasper as a tourist attraction.

episodes.title: This Little Wiggy
episodes.description: Bart is appalled when Marge pairs him with Ralph Wiggum.

episodes.title: Simpson Tide
episodes.description: Homer becomes the captain of a Navy submarine.  Bart gets his ear pierced.

episodes.title: The Trouble with Trillions
episodes.description: When a tax audit lands him in hot water, Homer goes undercover for the government and attempts to retrieve a trillion dollar note from Mr. Burns.

episodes.title: Girly Edition
episodes.description: Bart attempts to upstage Lisa when the pair co-host a children's news program.  Homer obtains a helper monkey.

episodes.title: Trash of the Titans
episodes.description: Homer enters the race for Sanitation Commissioner after garbage men refuse to collect his trash.

episodes.title: King of the Hill
episodes.description: After improving his physique, Homer attempts to climb a treacherous mountain.

episodes.title: Lost Our Lisa
episodes.description: Lisa gets lost in an unfamiliar part of town while searching for a museum. Bart adheres novelties to his face only to discover they cannot be removed.

episodes.title: Natural Born Kissers
episodes.description: Homer and Marge discover the secret to reigniting their sex life. Bart and Lisa hunt for hidden treasure using Grampa's old mine sweeper.

episodes.title: Lard of the Dance
episodes.description: Homer thinks he can net a fortune by recycling grease.  Lisa helps organize a school dance.

episodes.title: The Wizard of Evergreen Terrace
episodes.description: After realizing half his life is over, Homer decides to become the next Thomas Edison.

episodes.title: Bart the Mother
episodes.description: Bart tends to a nest filled with eggs after he inadvertently kills a bird with a BB gun.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror IX
episodes.description: An evil toupee possesses Homer; Bart and Lisa find themselves trapped inside an Itchy & Scratchy cartoon; baby Maggie turns out to be the daughter of a space alien.

episodes.title: When You Dish Upon a Star
episodes.description: Homer befriends a group of Hollywood celebrities vacationing in a remote part of town and promises to keep their whereabouts a secret.

episodes.title: D'oh-in' in the Wind
episodes.description: Homer embraces his newly discovered hippie heritage.

episodes.title: Lisa Gets an 'A'
episodes.description: Lisa suffers a guilty conscience after she cheats on an exam.  Homer believes he will save a fortune by raising his own lobster.

episodes.title: Homer Simpson in: 'Kidney Trouble'
episodes.description: Homer offers to donate one of his kidneys to Grampa until he realizes the surgery will place his own life in jeopardy.

episodes.title: Mayored to the Mob
episodes.description: Homer takes on the mob when he acts as Mayor Quimby's bodyguard.

episodes.title: Viva Ned Flanders
episodes.description: Homer shows Flanders how to enjoy life by taking him to Las Vegas.

episodes.title: Wild Barts Can't Be Broken
episodes.description: The children of Springfield rebel after Wiggum enforces a curfew.

episodes.title: Sunday, Cruddy Sunday
episodes.description: Homer and his friends eagerly anticipate attending the Super Bowl until a ticketing snafu threatens to keep them from seeing the game.

episodes.title: Homer to the Max
episodes.description: Homer changes his name when a dimwitted television show character named "Homer Simpson" becomes an overnight sensation.

episodes.title: I'm with Cupid
episodes.description: Apu showers his wife with Valentine's Day surprises making men throughout Springfield look like cheapskates.

episodes.title: Marge Simpson in: 'Screaming Yellow Honkers'
episodes.description: Marge discovers the pleasures of driving a sport utility vehicle until aggressive highway habits cost her.

episodes.title: Make Room for Lisa
episodes.description: Lisa exhibits signs of stress when she is forced into sharing her brother's bedroom.  Marge becomes addicted to eavesdropping on cellular phone conversations.

episodes.title: Maximum Homerdrive
episodes.description: Homer and Bart attempt to deliver a dead trucker's cargo on schedule.  Meanwhile, Marge decides to have an adventure of her own and purchases a new doorbell.

episodes.title: Simpsons Bible Stories
episodes.description: While listening to one of Reverend Lovejoy's sermons on a sweltering Easter Sunday morning, the Simpsons fall asleep and envision themselves as characters from the Bible.

episodes.title: Mom and Pop Art
episodes.description: Homer pursues a career as an artist when his misshapen barbecue pit attracts the attention of a gallery.

episodes.title: The Old Man and the 'C' Student
episodes.description: Bart must perform community service at Grampa's retirement home.

episodes.title: Monty Can't Buy Me Love
episodes.description: Mr. Burns attempts to win adoration by transporting the Loch Ness monster to Springfield.

episodes.title: They Saved Lisa's Brain
episodes.description: Lisa is invited to join Mensa; Homer receives a free erotic photo session.

episodes.title: Thirty Minutes Over Tokyo
episodes.description: The Simpsons board a mega-saver flight for Tokyo, only to find themselves trapped overseas when they run out of money.

episodes.title: Beyond Blunderdome
episodes.description: Studio executives panic when actor Mel Gibson taps Homer to help him retool his latest film.

episodes.title: Brother's Little Helper
episodes.description: Bart is diagnosed with Attention Deficit Disorder and placed on medication that quells his disruptive behavior.

episodes.title: Guess Who's Coming to Criticize Dinner
episodes.description: Homer becomes the Springfield Shopper's new food critic, but raises the ire of restaurateurs by panning their cooking.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror X
episodes.description: Homer's Y2K error plunges the Earth into chaos; Bart and Lisa become superheroes and attempt to save Lucy Lawless from a super-villain; someone terrorizes the family after Marge kills Ned Flanders.

episodes.title: E-I-E-I-(Annoyed Grunt)
episodes.description: The Simpsons relocate to a farm, where Homer produces a tomato that is highly addictive.

episodes.title: Hello Gutter, Hello Fadder
episodes.description: Homer becomes an instant celebrity when he bowls a perfect game.  But when his fame fades away, he lavishes his time on baby Maggie.

episodes.title: Eight Misbehavin'
episodes.description: Apu is driven to the brink when his wife, Manjula, gives birth to octuplets.

episodes.title: Take My Wife, Sleaze
episodes.description: Homer wins a vintage motorcycle during a dance contest - and attracts the attention of Hell's Satans when he forms his own gang.

episodes.title: Grift of the Magi
episodes.description: As the Christmas holiday approaches... Springfield Elementary closes its doors for financial reasons, only to reopen when a mysterious organization steps in to help.

episodes.title: Little Big Mom
episodes.description: Lisa becomes mother-of-the-house when Marge is hospitalized with a broken leg.

episodes.title: Faith Off
episodes.description: Bart believes he has the power to heal the sick.

episodes.title: The Mansion Family
episodes.description: The Simpsons care for Burns' mansion when the billionaire leaves town for a medical exam.

episodes.title: Saddlesore Galactica
episodes.description: When Homer and Bart transform a loser racehorse into a champion, rival jockeys threaten revenge.

episodes.title: Alone Again Natura-Diddily
episodes.description: Homer attempts to help when Flanders experiences a tragic loss.

episodes.title: Missionary Impossible
episodes.description: Homer is forced to become a missionary on a remote island after he pledges a large sum of money to PBS.

episodes.title: Pygmoelian
episodes.description: Moe undergoes plastic surgery and becomes a hot new soap opera star.

episodes.title: Bart to the Future
episodes.description: A Native American casino manager shows Bart a glimpse into the future... a time when Bart is an over-the-hill moocher and Lisa is President of the United States.

episodes.title: Days of Wine and D'Ohses
episodes.description: Barney swears off alcohol, creating a rift between he and Homer; seeking to win a contest, Bart and Lisa attempt to photograph a new cover for the Springfield phone book.

episodes.title: Kill the Alligator and Run
episodes.description: The Simpsons find themselves on the run from the law after they accidentally kill a beloved alligator while vacationing in Florida.

episodes.title: Last Tap Dance in Springfield
episodes.description: After watching a movie about a sexy tango dancer, Lisa enrolls in a tap dance class... only to discover she has two left feet; Bart and Milhouse abandon a camping trip and hide out in a shopping mall.

episodes.title: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad Marge
episodes.description: When Otto ditches his fiancée at the altar, Bart invites her to stay with the family... forcing Marge to compete with the much younger woman.

episodes.title: Behind the Laughter
episodes.description: This 'behind-the-scenes' special chronicles the ups and downs of America's favorite sitcom family.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XI
episodes.description: On Halloween... a deceased Homer must perform one good deed to get into heaven; angry dolphins launch an attack against the people of Springfield; Bart and Lisa encounter characters from fairy tales.

episodes.title: A Tale of Two Springfields
episodes.description: The townspeople of Springfield divide into two communities when the telephone company institutes a new area code system.

episodes.title: Insane Clown Poppy
episodes.description: Krusty discovers that he fathered a child during the Gulf War... only to gamble away his daughter's precious violin during a poker game with Fat Tony.

episodes.title: Lisa the Treehugger
episodes.description: Lisa joins a group of eco-radicals in her attempt to save the city's oldest redwood tree.

episodes.title: Homer vs. Dignity
episodes.description: As the Thanksgiving holiday approaches, Mr. Burns hires Homer to be his 'prank monkey.'

episodes.title: The Computer Wore Menace Shoes
episodes.description: Homer uses his new computer to spread gossip on the Internet... and eventually finds himself stranded on a mysterious island.

episodes.title: The Great Money Caper
episodes.description: Homer and Bart become scam artists when the family is faced with the cost of a sudden car repair.

episodes.title: Skinner's Sense of Snow
episodes.description: As Christmas approaches, a winter snowstorm traps Bart, Lisa and their fellow students inside Springfield Elementary, where Principal Skinner attempts to keep chaos from erupting.

episodes.title: HOMR
episodes.description: Homer experiences a dramatic increase in intelligence when researchers remove a crayon lodged in his brain.

episodes.title: Pokey Mom
episodes.description: With Marge's help, an inmate with artistic ability is paroled from prison.  But when the ex-con gets a job painting a mural at the elementary school, he clashes with Skinner.

episodes.title: Worst Episode Ever
episodes.description: When the Comic Book Guy suffers a heart attack, Bart and Milhouse take over his store.

episodes.title: Tennis the Menace
episodes.description: When the Simpsons construct a tennis court in the backyard, Bart pairs up with Marge and becomes a tennis whiz... much to Homer's disappointment.

episodes.title: Day of the Jackanapes
episodes.description: Sideshow Bob wins release from prison and hypnotizes Bart to kill Krusty the Clown.

episodes.title: New Kids on the Blecch
episodes.description: After casting Bart and his friends as singers in an all-boy band, a crazed record producer launches an attack on the offices of MAD magazine.

episodes.title: Hungry Hungry Homer
episodes.description: Homer goes on a hunger strike after learning that the owner of the Springfield Isotopes plans on moving the team to Albuquerque.

episodes.title: Bye Bye Nerdy
episodes.description: Lisa searches for answers when a new student at school bullies her; Homer starts his own baby-proofing business.

episodes.title: Simpson Safari
episodes.description: The Simpsons journey through Africa, where they encounter jungle animals, tribesmen... and a chimp refuge owner with a secret.

episodes.title: Trilogy of Error
episodes.description: A day in the life of the Simpsons replays three times: Homer panics when Marge slices off his thumb; Lisa attempts to place her entry in the school science fair; Bart is pursued by gangsters.

episodes.title: I'm Goin' to Praise Land
episodes.description: To fulfill his dead wife's final wish, Ned Flanders converts an old, closed amusement park into a new Christian amusement park, 'Praiseland.'  The park flops until visitors begin having 'visions.'

episodes.title: Children of a Lesser Clod
episodes.description: After Homer injures his knee, he's housebound for recuperation.  A successful stint as a babysitter prompts Homer to open a full-time daycare service, leaving Bart and Lisa feeling neglected.

episodes.title: Simpsons Tall Tales
episodes.description: The Simpsons jump a train, and meet a hobo, who tells them twisted versions of three classic tales, all of which feature Simpsons characters.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XII
episodes.description: On Halloween, the Simpsons are menaced by a computer controlling an automated house; a gypsy curses Homer; Lisa and Bart find themselves in a Harry Potter-like adventure.

episodes.title: The Parent Rap
episodes.description: A stern judge rules that Homer and Bart are to be tethered together, and later, Homer and Marge are declared bad parents and placed in old-fashioned wooden stocks.

episodes.title: Homer the Moe
episodes.description: Moe turns the bar into a pretentious hang-out for Springfield's 'beautiful people,' forcing Homer to start a bar of his own inside his garage.

episodes.title: Hunka Hunka Burns in Love
episodes.description: When Mr. Burns falls for an attractive traffic cop many years his junior, he enlists Homer's help in romancing her.

episodes.title: The Blunder Years
episodes.description: When placed under hypnosis, Homer struggles with a repressed memory-which leads to a shocking discovery.

episodes.title: She of Little Faith
episodes.description: As Christmas approaches... Lisa searches for a new religion after Mr. Burns takes over her church and runs it like a corporation.

episodes.title: Brawl in the Family
episodes.description: A social worker attempts to transform the family into a functional, cooperative unit... until Homer's other wife shows up unexpectedly.

episodes.title: Sweets and Sour Marge
episodes.description: After Springfield wins the title of World's Fattest Town, Marge launches an anti-sugar crusade, and sugar is banned from the city.

episodes.title: Jaws Wired Shut
episodes.description: When Homer has to have his jaw wired shut, he discovers the joys of listening, but Marge finds that a well-behaved Homer isn't what she really wanted.

episodes.title: Half-Decent Proposal
episodes.description: Marge's ex-boyfriend, now one of the world's richest men, offers Homer a million dollars in exchange for a weekend with her, to see what 'might have been.'

episodes.title: The Bart Wants What It Wants
episodes.description: Bart travels to Canada to win back the heart of Rainier Wolfcastle's daughter after she runs off with Milhouse.

episodes.title: The Lastest Gun in the West
episodes.description: Bart befriends an aging movie cowboy who begins drinking heavily when asked to appear on Krusty's television show.

episodes.title: The Old Man and the Key
episodes.description: In an effort to win a date with a beautiful new resident at the nursing home, Grampa gets his driver's license back... and gives chase when the object of his affection leaves for Branson, Missouri.

episodes.title: Tales From the Public Domain
episodes.description: The Simpsons appear as characters in three classic tales: Homer as Odysseus leads the Greek army; Bart as Hamlet attempts to avenge the death of his father; Lisa as Joan of Arc pits the French against the English.

episodes.title: Blame it on Lisa
episodes.description: When the Simpsons fly to Brazil to locate a missing orphan that Lisa has been sponsoring, Homer ends up getting kidnapped.

episodes.title: Weekend at Burnsie's
episodes.description: When Homer is attacked by crows, he's prescribed medical marijuana to help relieve the pain... leading Burns to promote his happy employee to executive vice president of the power plant.

episodes.title: Gump Roast
episodes.description: Homer is roasted at the Springfield Friar's Club, leading to recollections from the past.  But the fate of the Earth hangs in the balance when aliens Kang and Kodos make an unexpected appearance.

episodes.title: I am Furious Yellow
episodes.description: Bart launches a comic book with an angry Homer as the main character, and when it proves a huge success, Homer vows to give up getting angry for Lent.

episodes.title: The Sweetest Apu
episodes.description: When Manjula kicks Apu out of the house for cheating on her, Homer and Marge search for a way to reunite the couple.

episodes.title: Little Girl in the Big Ten
episodes.description: Lisa is overjoyed when she befriends some college students; Bart becomes a boy-in-a-plastic-bubble after he's bitten by a Chinese mosquito.

episodes.title: Frying Game
episodes.description: Homer and Marge become murder suspects after an elderly shut-in the couple befriended is found dead.

episodes.title: Papa's Got a Brand New Badge
episodes.description: When Wiggum and his men prove ineffective in controlling a citywide riot, townspeople begin to feel unsafe... until Homer forms his own police force.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XIII
episodes.description: On Halloween, Homer's evil hammock produces an army of Homer clones; zombie cowboys threaten to destroy Springfield after Lisa outlaws guns; the Simpsons travel to an island inhabited by 'manimals.'

episodes.title: How I Spent My Strummer Vacation
episodes.description: When a hidden camera tapes Homer lamenting that having a family meant kissing goodbye his dreams of becoming a rock 'n' roll star, Marge enrolls him a fantasy rock star camp run by The Rolling Stones.

episodes.title: Bart vs. Lisa vs. 3rd Grade
episodes.description: Bart and Lisa are horrified when they both end up in the same 3rd grade class.

episodes.title: Large Marge
episodes.description: Marge's life changes dramatically when her attempt to lose weight via surgery resulting in larger breasts; Bart and Milhouse get into mischief that leads to a public relations nightmare for Krusty.

episodes.title: Helter Shelter
episodes.description: When the Simpson house undergoes fumigation, the family is forced to seek shelter elsewhere... and ends up participating in a reality TV program set in a house from the 1800s.

episodes.title: The Great Louse Detective
episodes.description: When someone attempts to murder Homer, Sideshow Bob is released from prison to help identify the culprit before he strikes again.

episodes.title: Special Edna
episodes.description: When Bart gets Mrs. Krabappel nominated for Teacher of the Year, the family heads for Orlando to attend the ceremony.  But Skinner fears he may lose Krabappel forever... and asks Bart to sabotage the affair.

episodes.title: The Dad Who Knew Too Little
episodes.description: Homer hires a shady private investigator to spy on Lisa when he realizes he doesn't know very much about his daughter.

episodes.title: The Strong Arms of The Ma
episodes.description: When Marge is mugged at the Kwik-E-Mart, she develops agoraphobia and ends up living in the basement... until she turns into a fearless bodybuilder.

episodes.title: Pray Anything
episodes.description: Inspired by Ned Flanders, Homer turns to prayer in hopes of changing his lot in life.  But when he injures himself coming out of church, Homer sues for damages... and is awarded the church itself.

episodes.title: Barting Over
episodes.description: When Bart discovers the existence of an embarrassing TV commercial he appeared in as a baby-and that Homer spent the money he earned-he sues for emancipation and moves out of the house.

episodes.title: I'm Spelling as Fast as I Can
episodes.description: When Lisa becomes a finalist in a spelling bee, she's offered a college scholarship in exchange for losing; Homer falls hopelessly in love with Krustyburger's limited-time-only rib sandwich.

episodes.title: A Star is Born-Again
episodes.description: A Hollywood movie star takes a romantic interest in Ned Flanders, and when the relationship blossoms, Ned's faith is put to the test when the star wants to have premarital sex.

episodes.title: Mr. Spritz Goes To Washington
episodes.description: When Springfield Airport changes the flight paths of airplanes, sending them over the Simpson's house, the family convinces Krusty to run for congress so he can change the law.

episodes.title: C.E.D'oh
episodes.description: On Valentine's Day, Homer attends a college course on how to succeed in the corporate world, he becomes the owner of the power plant and fires Mr. Burns... only to realize that running the plant means being away from family.

episodes.title: 'Scuse Me While I Miss The Sky
episodes.description: As a British filmmaker makes a documentary about Springfield Elementary, Lisa tires to save the nighttime sky from light pollution, while Bart attempts to restore his coolness by obtaining a hood ornament from Fat Tony's car.

episodes.title: Three Gays of the Condo
episodes.description: Homer moves in with a gay couple after discovering a letter Marge wrote years earlier that implies she resents him.

episodes.title: Dude, Where's My Ranch?
episodes.description: While vacationing at a dude ranch, Lisa falls for a cute 13-year-old cowboy; Homer vows to stop beavers who've dammed a river and kept Native Americans from their land.

episodes.title: Old Yeller-Belly
episodes.description: When Santa's Little Helper becomes Duff Beer's new, highly-paid mascot, his original owner comes out of the woodwork and claims the dog belongs to him.

episodes.title: Brake My Wife, Please
episodes.description: When Homer loses his driver's license, he embraces walking.  But Marge begins to suffer from stress when the pressure of being the only full-time driver in the house takes its toll-and ends up running Homer over in her car.

episodes.title: The Bart of War
episodes.description: After police discover Bart and Milhouse ransacking Flanders' Beatles memorabilia, Marge decides to place her son in a supervised activity, the Pre-Teen Braves.

episodes.title: Moe Baby Blues
episodes.description: When Moe saves baby Maggie's life, a close bond forms.  But when Maggie wanders off with some gangsters, Homer and Marge mistakenly believe that Moe is responsible for the baby's disappearance.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XIV
episodes.description: On Halloween, Homer takes over for the Grim Reaper and discovers Marge's name on his list; Professor Frink reanimates his father's corpse; Bart and Milhouse play pranks with a watch that can stop time.

episodes.title: My Mother the Carjacker
episodes.description: Mother Simpson is captured by police and placed on trial for sabotaging Mr. Burns' germ warfare plant in the 1960s.  Homer's heartfelt testimony helps win her release... but Mr. Burns concocts a plot to get revenge.

episodes.title: The President Wore Pearls
episodes.description: When Lisa is elected student body president, she vows to make the school a better place to learn.  But Skinner tricks her into cutting well-liked programs... prompting Lisa to call a general student strike.

episodes.title: The Regina Monologues
episodes.description: The Simpsons travel to England, where Homer is imprisoned in the Tower of London after he smashes a car into the Queen's royal coach.

episodes.title: The Fat and the Furriest
episodes.description: Homer becomes the laughing stock of the town when a wild bear humiliates him.  But when he seeks a rematch, Homer bonds with the animal and tries to save its life.

episodes.title: Today I am a Clown
episodes.description: When Krusty takes the Sabbath off so he can study for his bar mitzvah, he chooses Homer as temporary guest host.  But when Homer's career unexpectedly takes off, Krusty finds himself out of a job.

episodes.title: 'Tis the Fifteenth Season
episodes.description: As Christmas approaches, Homer discovers the true meaning of the season after watching an animated version of A Christmas Carol on television.  But Flanders find it impossible to live as the second-nicest-guy in town.

episodes.title: Marge vs. Singles, Seniors, Childless Couples and Teens, and Gays
episodes.description: Marge opposes a political group made up of childless people who've grown fed-up with accommodating people with families.

episodes.title: I, (Annoyed Grunt)-Bot
episodes.description: Homer builds a fighting robot for Bart, but finds he must hide inside the device to make it work; Lisa searches for a replacement for Snowball II when the cat is run over by a car.

episodes.title: Diatribe of a Mad Housewife
episodes.description: Homer buys an ambulance and starts responding to medical emergencies; Marge authors her own romance novel.

episodes.title: Margical History Tour
episodes.description: Marge tells the children three historical tales: the story of King Henry the Eighth and his quest for a son; Sacagawea's journey with Lewis and Clark; and the rivalry between Mozart and Salieri.

episodes.title: Milhouse Doesn't Live Here Anymore
episodes.description: When Milhouse and his mother relocate to Capital City, Bart strikes up a friendship with Lisa; Homer makes money by pretending to be a transient.

episodes.title: Smart and Smarter
episodes.description: Lisa searches for a new identity when baby Maggie turns out to be smarter than her.

episodes.title: The Ziff Who Came to Dinner
episodes.description: Homer becomes the majority shareholder of Artie Ziff's troubled Internet company-and ends up being arrested by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

episodes.title: Co-Dependent's Day
episodes.description: When a drunken Homer loses control of his car, he places an unconscious Marge in the driver's seat so she'll be blamed for the accident; Lisa and Bart complain to the creator of the Cosmic Wars saga about his latest films.

episodes.title: The Wandering Juvie
episodes.description: Bart's latest prank lands him in juvenile prison, where a tough girl forces him to go on the lam.

episodes.title: My Big Fat Geek Wedding
episodes.description: Mrs. Krabappel dumps Principal Skinner at the altar and has a passionate affair with the Comic Book Guy.

episodes.title: Catch 'Em If You Can
episodes.description: Bart and Lisa pursue Homer and Marge after they sneak away on a second honeymoon; Grampa catches the eye of a dashing Cuban man.

episodes.title: Simple Simpson
episodes.description: Homer confronts evildoers in the form of his crime-fighting alter ego, the Pie Man-until Mr. Burns blackmails him into throwing a pie at the Dalai Lama.

episodes.title: The Way We Weren't
episodes.description: Homer reveals that Marge wasn't the first girl he ever kissed, but as he and Marge recount their versions of time spent at a summer camp, Homer realizes he caused Marge thirty years of heartbreak.

episodes.title: Bart-Mangled Banner
episodes.description: The Simpsons are thrown in prison after Bart accidentally moons the American flag.

episodes.title: Fraudcast News
episodes.description: Mr. Burns buys up all the media outlets in Springfield in an effort to polish his image, but soon finds himself at odds with Lisa, who started publishing her own newspaper.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XV
episodes.description: On Halloween... Flanders can predict when people will die; in Victorian London, Lisa and Bart hunt for a killer; the Simpsons take a fantastic voyage after Mr. Burns swallows a miniaturized Maggie.

episodes.title: All's Fair in Oven War
episodes.description: Marge enters a bakeoff competition, but ends up sabotaging the other entries; Bart decides to live the life of a swinger after discovering Playdude magazine.

episodes.title: Sleeping with the Enemy
episodes.description: Lisa becomes self-conscious about her weight after kids at school make fun of her posterior;  Marge takes bully Nelson Muntz under her wing ... much to Bart's horror.

episodes.title: She Used to Be My Girl
episodes.description: Marge wonders if she made the right choices in life after she encounters a successful high school classmate who has traveled the world as a television news reporter.

episodes.title: Fat Man and Little Boy
episodes.description: Homer builds a nuclear reactor for Lisa's science project; Bart makes money creating his own line of t-shirts.

episodes.title: Midnight Rx
episodes.description: Homer and Grampa smuggle drugs out of Canada after Mr. Burns terminates his company's employee prescription drug program.

episodes.title: Mommie Beerest
episodes.description: Homer mortgages his house to save Moe's bar, but Marge ends up taking control of the business and spends so much time with Moe that Homer fears his marriage is in trouble.

episodes.title: Homer and Ned's Hail Mary Pass
episodes.description: After teaching famous athletes some victory dance moves, Homer is chosen to produce the Super Bowl half-time show; Flanders makes a movie featuring violent reenactments of biblical events.

episodes.title: Pranksta Rap
episodes.description: After sneaking off to a rap concert, Bart fakes his own kidnapping and inadvertently implicates Milhouse's father in the 'crime.'

episodes.title: There's Something About Marrying
episodes.description: When tourists shun Springfield, the town legalizes gay marriage in hopes of reversing the dire economic slowdown - and Homer makes money by becoming an ordained minister.

episodes.title: On a Clear Day I Can't See My Sister
episodes.description: After Bart torments his sister during a school field trip, Lisa gets a restraining order; Homer takes a job as a greeter at a local mega-store.

episodes.title: Goo Goo Gai Pan
episodes.description: Homer pretends to be Selma's husband when Selma travels to China to adopt a baby.

episodes.title: Mobile Homer
episodes.description: Bart and Lisa attempt to save Homer and Marge's marriage after Homer spends the family's savings on a recreational vehicle.

episodes.title: The Seven-Beer Snitch
episodes.description: Homer becomes a prison snitch after he's convicted of breaking an outdated law; Lisa and Bart discover that Snowball II has a secret life.

episodes.title: Future-Drama
episodes.description: Using Professor Frink's astrological projection machine, Bart and Lisa peer into the future, where Bart breaks Lisa's heart by taking away her scholarship to Yale.

episodes.title: Don't Fear the Roofer
episodes.description: Homer ends up in a mental institution after Marge grows convinced the contractor he befriended is a figment of his imagination; Marge allows Santa's Little Helper to stay at Grampa's retirement home.

episodes.title: The Heartbroke Kid
episodes.description: Bart has a heart attack after he becomes addicted to junk food; the Simpsons turn the house into a youth hostel, which is soon overrun by German backpackers.

episodes.title: A Star is Torn
episodes.description: Homer behaves like a domineering stage mom after Lisa achieves fame by appearing in a singing competition on The Krusty the Clown Show.

episodes.title: Thank God It's Doomsday
episodes.description: Homer is declared a prophet after he convinces everyone in town that the end of the world is at hand.

episodes.title: The Father, The Son, and The Holy Guest Star
episodes.description: After Bart gets expelled, he's enrolled in Catholic school, where he befriends a priest who wants to convert him and Homer to Catholicism.

episodes.title: Home Away From Homer
episodes.description: Flanders feels like a fool after sorority girls run an adult Web site from his house without his knowledge, so he and the boys move away from Springfield... to a town where everyone looks like a Hummel figurine.

episodes.title: The Bonfire of the Manatees
episodes.description: When Homer allows the mob to film a pornographic movie at the house, a disgusted Marge leaves the family and hooks up with a doctor trying to save the lives of manatees.

episodes.title: The Girl Who Slept Too Little
episodes.description: Lisa must confront her darkest fears after a cemetery is relocated to the Simpsons' neighborhood.

episodes.title: Milhouse of Sand and Fog
episodes.description: After Kirk and Luann rekindle their relationship, Bart and Milhouse plot to end the romance... only to inadvertently cause Homer and Marge to break up instead.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XVI
episodes.description: On Halloween, Bart is replaced by a robotic boy after he falls into a coma; Burns hunts down Homer in a most dangerous game; a witch transforms trick-or-treaters into the costumes they're wearing.

episodes.title: Marge's Son Poisoning
episodes.description: After spending time with her son, Marge begins to worry that she's turning Bart into a momma's boy; Homer enters an arm-wrestling competition.

episodes.title: See Homer Run
episodes.description: After winning popularity as the Safety Salamander, Homer challenges Quimby during a special mayoral recall election.

episodes.title: The Last of the Red Hat Mamas
episodes.description: A lonely Marge joins a women's group; Milhouse teaches Lisa how to speak Italian.

episodes.title: The Italian Bob
episodes.description: The Simpsons travel to Italy to retrieve Mr. Burn's expensive new sports car... only to encounter Sideshow Bob and his murderous family.

episodes.title: Simpsons Christmas Stories
episodes.description: The Simpsons appear in three Christmas tales: the story of the birth of Jesus; a World War II tale featuring Grampa, Mr. Burns and Santa; and a musical featuring The Nutcracker suite.

episodes.title: Homer's Paternity Coot
episodes.description: When an old letter is delivered to the Simpson home, Homer comes to believe that Grampa isn't his biological father after all.

episodes.title: We're on the Road to D'ohwhere
episodes.description: After Bart gets into trouble at school, Homer drives Bart to Oregon, where he attends a behavior modification camp; Marge becomes a popular drug dealer after she sells Homer's pain medications during a yard sale.

episodes.title: My Fair Laddy
episodes.description: Lisa vows to turn Groundskeeper Willie into a 'proper gentleman' in time for the upcoming school science fair; Homer tries to find something to wear after he rips his favorite blue pants.

episodes.title: The Seemingly Never-Ending Story
episodes.description: When the Simpsons become trapped inside a cave, Lisa recounts a story involving a bag of gold coins and how it affected the lives of Mr. Burns, Moe and Homer.

episodes.title: Bart Has Two Mommies
episodes.description: Marge teaches Rod and Todd Flanders how to have fun; a lonely chimpanzee grabs hold of Bart.

episodes.title: Homer Simpson, This is Your Wife
episodes.description: Marge swaps places with a British wife after the Simpsons become contestants on a reality television show.

episodes.title: Million Dollar Abie
episodes.description: After costing Springfield a professional football team, Grampa tries to end his life, but the experience changes him, and he ends up becoming a matador.

episodes.title: Kiss Kiss Bang Bangalore
episodes.description: Mr. Burns closes the nuclear power plant and outsources all the jobs, forcing Homer to relocate to India; MacGyver fans Patty and Selma kidnap actor Richard Dean Anderson.

episodes.title: The Wettest Stories Ever Told
episodes.description: The Simpsons appear in three stories set at sea: the journey of The Mayflower, the mutiny on The Bounty, and the capsizing of a cruise ship.

episodes.title: Girls Just Want to Have Sums
episodes.description: After Skinner is fired for insinuating that girls are inferior to boys in math, Springfield Elementary is split into two groups-boys and girls-forcing Lisa to dress up like a boy so she can attend a math class.

episodes.title: Regarding Margie
episodes.description: After Marge develops amnesia and can't remember anything about Homer, she decides to kick him out of the house and see other people.

episodes.title: The Monkey Suit
episodes.description: Lisa protests when Springfield passes a law requiring that creationism be taught alongside evolution in public schools.

episodes.title: Marge and Homer Turn a Couple Play
episodes.description: Homer and Marge play marriage counselors to help a baseball player and his sexy recording artist-wife.

episodes.title: The Mook, the Chef, the Wife and Her Homer
episodes.description: Lisa befriends the son of mobster Fat Tony, whose dream is to become a chef; Homer and Bart take over the 'family business' after Fat Tony is gunned down.

episodes.title: Jazzy and the Pussycats
episodes.description: Lisa grows jealous after Bart discovers he's a talented jazz drummer; Lisa hides some stray animals in the attic.

episodes.title: Please Homer, Don't Hammer 'em
episodes.description: Marge starts her own carpentry business, only to discover that men don't trust a woman to do the job; Bart discovers that Skinner is allergic to peanuts.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XVII
episodes.description: The Simpsons appear in three tales of horror: Homer turns into a rampaging blob; a creature from Jewish folklore does Bart's bidding; a radio broadcast convinces townspeople they're being invaded by aliens.

episodes.title: G.I. (Annoyed Grunt)
episodes.description: After Homer joins the Army, he's selected to play an enemy target during war games.  When the Army chases Homer into town, it pits the people of Springfield against the military.

episodes.title: Moe 'N' a Lisa
episodes.description: Lisa helps Moe get a poem published, but is deeply hurt when Moe refuses to acknowledge her contribution.

episodes.title: Ice Cream of Margie (With the Light Blue Hair)
episodes.description: Homer finds happiness after he buys an ice cream truck; Marge finds her purpose in life when she makes sculptures out of popsicle sticks.

episodes.title: The Haw-Hawed Couple
episodes.description: Bart becomes Nelson's best friend; Homer becomes hooked on one of Lisa's fantasy books.

episodes.title: Kill Gil (Parts I and II)
episodes.description: During the Christmas holiday, Marge attempts to muster the wherewithal to kick down-on-his-luck Gil out of the house.

episodes.title: The Wife Aquatic
episodes.description: Marge returns to an island where she joyfully spent some of her childhood summers; Homer is forced to work on a fishing vessel that's threatened by a huge storm.

episodes.title: Revenge is a Dish Best Served Three Times
episodes.description: The Simpsons spin three tales of revenge; Homer appears as the Count of Monte Cristo; Milhouse uses a gadget to get even with kids who've picked on him; comic hero Bart-Man searches for the villain who killed his parents.

episodes.title: Little Big Girl
episodes.description: As Multicultural Day approaches, Lisa invents her own Native American heritage; after saving Springfield from a fire, Bart is rewarded with a driver's license-and ends up with a pregnant girlfriend who wants to wed.

episodes.title: Springfield Up
episodes.description: In this spoof of the 'Up' documentaries, a filmmaker chronicles the lives of a group of Springfield residents, including Homer, who has seemingly made good on his quest to become a millionaire.

episodes.title: Yokel Chords
episodes.description: Lisa tutors Cletus's children - until Krusty hires them as a novelty act for his television show; Bart sees a female therapist after he's caught frightening his classmates with a scary story.

episodes.title: Rome-old and Juli-eh
episodes.description: Homer is horrified when his father begins dating Selma; Bart and Lisa build a fort after acquiring a large quantity of empty cardboard boxes.

episodes.title: Homerazzi
episodes.description: Homer tries his hand at making money by photographing celebrities and selling the images to the tabloids.

episodes.title: Marge Gamer
episodes.description: After discovering the Internet, Marge becomes a character in a popular online fantasy game; Homer referees Lisa's soccer team.

episodes.title: The Boys of Bummer
episodes.description: Bart becomes the shame of Springfield after a bungle on the playing field causes the Isotots to lose a pennant game; Homer and Marge fight Reverend Lovejoy and his wife over possession of Homer's mattress.

episodes.title: Crook and Ladder
episodes.description: Homer and his friends join the volunteer fire department, only to begin stealing from fire victims.

episodes.title: Stop Or My Dog Will Shoot
episodes.description: When Santa's Little Helper gets a job on the police force, Bart buys a python to replace him.

episodes.title: 24 Minutes
episodes.description: In this spoof of the television series '24,' Bart attempts to stop Jimbo, Dolph and Kearney before they unleash a deadly stink bomb at an upcoming school bake sale.

episodes.title: You Kent Always Say What You Want
episodes.description: Kent Brockman accidentally utters an obscenity during a news broadcast, leading to a heavy fine from the FCC - and costing Brockman his job.

episodes.title: He Loves To Fly And He D'ohs
episodes.description: Marge hires a life coach to turn Homer around after he becomes convinced he's nothing but a loser.

episodes.title: Homer of Seville
episodes.description: Homer becomes an opera star, only to find himself the target of an obsessed fan.

episodes.title: Midnight Towboy
episodes.description: Homer makes enemies when he starts his own tow truck business; Marge hires outside help to make Maggie more independent.

episodes.title: I Don't Wanna Know Why the Caged Bird Sings
episodes.description: Marge fears for her safety after breaking a promise to a bank robber about visiting him in jail.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XVIII
episodes.description: In three tales of Halloween terror: Homer and Marge attempt to eliminate one another after discovering their secret identities; Bart and Lisa aid Kodos the space alien; Flanders uses the seven deadly sins to punish Bart.

episodes.title: Little Orphan Millie
episodes.description: When his parents are lost at sea and presumed dead, Milhouse becomes cooler than Bart; Homer finds himself in hot water when he can't remember the color of Marge's eyes.

episodes.title: Husbands and Knives
episodes.description: After Marge launches a gym for 'regular women' and becomes a successful businessperson, Homer decides to have his stomach stapled so she'll find him more attractive.

episodes.title: Funeral for a Fiend
episodes.description: After another of his attempts to kill the Simpsons is foiled, Sideshow Bob is put on trial.  During the proceedings, Bart accidentally kills his old nemesis.

episodes.title: Eternal Moonshine of the Simpson Mind
episodes.description: Homer wakes up from a blackout only to discover that Marge and the kids have left him.  Using a variety of methods, he probes his memory to unravel the mystery.

episodes.title: E. Pluribus Wiggum
episodes.description: When Springfield becomes the first city in the nation to hold a presidential primary, voters to turn the one person they can trust: Ralph Wiggum.

episodes.title: That 90's Show
episodes.description: Marge and Homer recount how Marge almost fell in love with a college professor during the 1990s.

episodes.title: Love, Springfieldian Style
episodes.description: When Homer and Marge become trapped in a tunnel of love, three Valentine's Day stories unfold: Bonnie and Clyde steal each other's hearts; a take-off on 'Lady and the Tramp'; punk rockers Lisa and Nelson are hooked on sweets.

episodes.title: The Debarted
episodes.description: Bart befriends a new kid at school, unaware that he's a snitch; after his car is damaged in an accident, Homer ends up with a fancy loaner.

episodes.title: Dial 'N' for Nerder
episodes.description: Bart and Lisa think they killed Martin Prince; Marge enlists the help of a reality TV show after Homer cheats on his diet.

episodes.title: Smoke on the Daughter
episodes.description: Lisa becomes addicted to secondhand smoke when she joins a ballet academy; Homer befriends raccoons who stole his beef jerky.

episodes.title: Papa Don't Leech
episodes.description: Marge and Homer aid country singer Lurleen Lumpkin by reuniting her with her deadbeat father.

episodes.title: Apocalypse Cow
episodes.description: Bart is overjoyed when the calf he's raising is judged Best in Show - until he realizes the animal is going to be slaughtered.

episodes.title: Any Given Sundance
episodes.description: Lisa's documentary about life with the Simpsons is accepted into Sundance, but Lisa's initial elation turns to horror when festival-goers begin humiliating her dysfunctional family.

episodes.title: Mona Leaves-a
episodes.description: When Homer's mother returns to Springfield, she asks Homer for his forgiveness.

episodes.title: All About Lisa
episodes.description: Krusty hires Lisa to be his intern, but she's so good at the job, she ends up replacing him as host of his show; Bart and Homer discover the world of coin collecting.

episodes.title: Sex, Pies and Idiot Scrapes
episodes.description: Homer and Flanders team-up as bounty hunters; Marge makes confections for an erotic bakery.

episodes.title: Lost Verizon
episodes.description: When Bart steals actor Denis Leary's cell phone, Marge uses its built-in GPS signal to track her son... leading the family to the ancient ruins of Machu Picchu.

episodes.title: Double, Double, Boy in Trouble
episodes.description: Bart swaps places with his exact double-unaware that the double's wealthy siblings are plotting murder.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XIX
episodes.description: On Halloween... Transformer-like robots duke it out in Springfield; Homer kills off celebrities so their likenesses can be exploited; the Simpsons appear in a spoof of a 'Peanuts' Halloween special.

episodes.title: Dangerous Curves
episodes.description: In a series of flashbacks... Homer and Marge end up in a cabin in the woods with newlyweds Flanders and Maude; Homer and Marge's marriage is nearly ruined when they meet exciting new people during a party.

episodes.title: Homer and Lisa Exchange Cross Words
episodes.description: When Lisa discovers a talent for solving crossword puzzles, she enters a crossword tournament-unaware that Homer bet against her.

episodes.title: Mypods and Boomsticks
episodes.description: Homer thinks Bart's new Muslim friend belongs to a family of terrorists; Lisa acquires her first iPod-like device.

episodes.title: The Burns and the Bees
episodes.description: As Lisa tries to find a habitat for endangered bees, Mr. Burns builds a state-of-the-art sports arena-which happens to look like a giant hive.

episodes.title: Lisa the Drama Queen
episodes.description: Lisa's new best friend creates a fantasy world so real it threatens to drive them apart.
