episodes.title: Take My Life, Please
episodes.description: When Homer discovers that he was almost elected class president in high school, an old Italian cook uses a magic pot of tomato sauce to show him an alternate version of his life.

episodes.title: How the Test Was Won
episodes.description: Lisa freezes during a federal school assessment test; Homer tries to prevent accidents from happening after he forgets to pay an insurance bill; Skinner accompanies Bart and other underachievers on a trip to Capital City.

episodes.title: No Loan Again, Naturally
episodes.description: When Homer and Marge's adjustable mortgage rate skyrockets, they're forced to move out of the house... until Flanders purchases the property and becomes their landlord.

episodes.title: Gone Maggie Gone
episodes.description: In this 'National Treasure'-like story... when Maggie disappears at a convent, Lisa goes undercover as a nun to solve a mystery involving a rare jewel.

episodes.title: In the Name of the Grandfather
episodes.description: The Simpsons travel to Ireland, where Homer and Grampa purchase an old pub that's fallen on hard times.

episodes.title: Wedding for Disaster
episodes.description: When their marriage license turns out to be invalid, Homer asks Marge to marry him in style.  But when Homer mysteriously disappears just before the wedding, Bart and Lisa search for answers.

episodes.title: Eeny Teeny Maya Moe
episodes.description: Moe meets a beautiful woman in an Internet chat room who turns out to be three feet tall; Homer tries to spend more time with Maggie.

episodes.title: The Good, The Sad, and The Drugly
episodes.description: Bart dumps Milhouse in favor of a cute girl who volunteers her time at the retirement home; Lisa is prescribed antidepressants after she reads predictions about what Springfield will look like in 50 years.

episodes.title: Father Knows Worst
episodes.description: As a result of Homer's "helicopter parenting," Lisa employs a trendy technique for boosting her popularity, while Bart enters a balsa-wood model-building contest; Marge discovers a sauna in the basement.

episodes.title: Waverly Hills 9-0-2-1-D'oh
episodes.description: Homer and Marge rent an apartment in tony Waverly Hills so Bart and Lisa can attend a better elementary school.

episodes.title: Four Great Women and a Manicure
episodes.description: As Marge and Lisa have their nails done, they spin four tales involving famous women: Queen Elizabeth, Snow White, Lady Macbeth and Ayn Rand.

episodes.title: Coming To Homerica
episodes.description: Springfield grapples with an immigration problem when the economy of nearby Ogdenville collapses.

episodes.title: Homer the Whopper
episodes.description: Homer ends up with a superhero's physique after he's chosen to appear in a film based on a character created by The Comic Book Guy.

episodes.title: Bart Gets A 'Z'
episodes.description: Principal Skinner fires Mrs. Krabappel after she makes a drunken fool of herself at the elementary school - but what Skinner doesn't know is that Bart spiked her coffee with alcohol.

episodes.title: The Great Wife Hope
episodes.description: Marge vows to drive mixed martial arts from Springfield by defeating a fight promoter in the ring.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XX
episodes.description: Classic movie monsters are attacked by their spouses; Lisa and Bart exchange murders in a Hitchcock spoof; Bart is the key to saving Springfield from zombies; Moe's microbrewery mixes beer with Homer's blood.

episodes.title: The Devil Wears Nada
episodes.description: Homer's life turns into nonstop misery when he becomes Carl's assistant; Marge poses for a sexy calendar.

episodes.title: Pranks and Greens
episodes.description: Skinner tells Bart about a former Springfield Elementary student who was the best prankster ever; Marge begins shopping at a natural foods store.

episodes.title: Rednecks and Broomsticks
episodes.description: Lisa befriends a group of Wiccans who are accused of blinding the people of Springfield with a spell.

episodes.title: O Brother, Where Bart Thou?
episodes.description: Bart attempts to get Homer and Marge pregnant so he can have a brother to hang out with.

episodes.title: Thursdays with Abie
episodes.description: Homer becomes jealous when a reporter takes an interest in Grampa's life; Lisa loses a stuffed lamb that Bart brought home from school.

episodes.title: Once Upon A Time in Springfield
episodes.description: Krusty ends up playing second fiddle to Princess Penelope, a new character on his show... only to end up falling in love with the actress who plays her.

episodes.title: Million Dollar Maybe
episodes.description: Homer wins a million-dollar lottery but doesn't tell his family the news; Lisa stimulates nursing home patients with an interactive Wii-like device.

episodes.title: Boy Meets Curl
episodes.description: The Simpsons head to the Winter Olympics in Canada after Marge and Homer join a curling team; Lisa becomes addicted to collecting Olympic pins.

episodes.title: The Color Yellow
episodes.description: Lisa discovers that her Southern ancestors helped a slave escape to freedom.

episodes.title: Postcards From the Wedge
episodes.description: Bart creates friction between Marge and Homer so he can get out of doing homework.  But when the plot fails, Bart tries to destroy the elementary school by reactivating an old Springfield subway line.

episodes.title: Stealing First Base
episodes.description: Bart stirs up trouble when he kisses a girl at school; Lisa's popularity soars when she receives a failing grade on a test.

episodes.title: The Greatest Story Ever D'ohed
episodes.description: Flanders attempts to redeem Homer during a Bible study trip to Israel; Homer becomes delusional after getting lost in the desert and ends up believing he's the Chosen One.

episodes.title: American History X-cellent
episodes.description: When Mr. Burns is sent to prison for possessing stolen art, he places Smithers in charge of running the nuclear power plant; Bart helps Lisa maintain an ant farm.

episodes.title: Chief of Hearts
episodes.description: After he's sentenced to perform community service, Homer befriends Chief Wiggum; Marge mistakes Bart's love for a Japanese card game for a drug addiction.

episodes.title: The Squirt and the Whale
episodes.description: Lisa comes to the aid of a whale that washes up on Springfield Beach.

episodes.title: To Surveil With Love
episodes.description: After a bomb squad mistakenly blows up Homer's unattended gym bag, releasing radiation into the city, Springfield equips itself with surveillance cameras to deter terrorism, allowing Flanders to impose his views on others.

episodes.title: Moe Letter Blues
episodes.description: As Mother's Day approaches, Homer, Apu and Reverend Lovejoy receive a letter from Moe warning that he's going to run away with one of their wives.

episodes.title: The Bob Next Door
episodes.description: Bart is convinced that his new neighbor is Sideshow Bob - even though the man looks nothing like his arch enemy.

episodes.title: Judge Me Tender
episodes.description: Moe discovers a talent for judging contests, leading to an appearance on the television series 'American Idol;' Homer drives Marge crazy when he begins hanging around the house.

episodes.title: Elementary School Musical
episodes.description: Lisa attends a performing arts camp; Krusty stands trial in The Hague after being tricked into believing he won the Nobel Prize.

episodes.title: Loan-A-Lisa
episodes.description: Lisa donates money to a microfinance bank to help Nelson's custom bicycle company; Homer games the system by purchasing expensive items from stores and, after using them for a period of time, returns them for a refund.

episodes.title: Money Bart
episodes.description: Lisa becomes the coach of Bart's Little League team... and ends up firing Bart after he ignores her instructions.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXI
episodes.description: Bart and Milhouse use their videogame skills to save Springfield; in a 'Dead Calm' spoof a vacationing Homer and Marge rescue a stranger who may be a murderer; Lisa falls for a hunky vampire in a spoof of 'Twilight'.

episodes.title: Lisa Simpson, This Isn't Your Life
episodes.description: Lisa decides she doesn't want to end up like Marge; Bart becomes the new school bully after Nelson is humiliated by a series of mishaps; Maggie becomes obsessed with owning a collectible elf figure.

episodes.title: The Fool Monty
episodes.description: When a dying Mr. Burns loses his memory, the residents of Springfield exact revenge on the abusive billionaire by using him as their plaything.

episodes.title: How Munched is that Birdie in the Window?
episodes.description: The Simpsons decide to give away Santa's Little Helper after the dog swallows Bart's beloved carrier pigeon.

episodes.title: The Fight Before Christmas
episodes.description: Four Christmas tales... Bart takes a 'Polar Express' ride to ask Santa for a dirt bike; Lisa worries after Marge is drafted to fight Nazis; Martha Stewart helps spruce-up the house; the family celebrates a Muppet Christmas.

episodes.title: Donnie Fatso
episodes.description: Acting as an undercover informant, Homer sets out to win the trust of mobster Fat Tony as part of the FBI's efforts to break up his crime syndicate.

episodes.title: Moms I'd Like To Forget
episodes.description: As Bart tries to determine the origin of a scar on his hand, Marge reacquaints herself with three old friends.

episodes.title: Flaming Moe
episodes.description: Smithers convinces Moe to turn his tavern into a gay bar; with Bart's help, Skinner romances the elementary school's new music teacher.

episodes.title: Homer the Father
episodes.description: Homer uses plotlines from a 1980's sitcom to deal with Bart when the boy grows obsessed with obtaining a cool mini-bike; Bart attempts to trade nuclear secrets to the Chinese government.

episodes.title: The Blue and the Gray
episodes.description: Unable to get a date for Valentine's Day, Moe asks Homer to act as his 'wingman' and help him attract women; Marge has her entire head of hair dyed gray after she discovers her first gray hair.

episodes.title: Angry Dad: The Movie
episodes.description: When the 'Angry Dad' character is turned into an award-winning animated short film, Homer hogs the spotlight... much to Bart's dismay.

episodes.title: The Scorpion's Tale
episodes.description: When Lisa discovers a wildflower that turns scorpions into blissful creatures, Homer secretly spikes Grampa's coffee with juice from the plant, turning him into a docile old man.

episodes.title: A Midsummer's Nice Dreams
episodes.description: When legendary comics Cheech and Chong split up, Cheech asks Homer to replace his old partner; Marge helps the Cat Lady empty her house of junk... only to become a hoarder herself.

episodes.title: Love is a Many Strangled Thing
episodes.description: Homer enrolls in a fathering enrichment class, where he undergoes treatment to stop the urge to strangle Bart.

episodes.title: The Great Simpsina
episodes.description: Lisa befriends an old magician who shows her how to perform one of Houdini's greatest tricks.

episodes.title: The Housewives of Fat Tony
episodes.description: Fat Tony asks for Selma's hand in marriage; Bart discovers a talent for sniffing out truffles.

episodes.title: Homer Scissorhands
episodes.description: Homer discovers a talent for cutting women's hair; Lisa becomes puzzled when a pretty girl at school shows an interest in Milhouse.

episodes.title: 500 Keys
episodes.description: A drawer full of old keys sparks several adventures: Homer steals the Duff blimp; Bart discovers he can do no wrong; Lisa discovers a strange room beneath Springfield Elementary; Marge and Maggie chase a toy train.

episodes.title: The Ned-liest Catch
episodes.description: Ned Flanders falls for Bart's teacher, Edna Krabappel... but will Krabappel's reputation for dating every guy in town spell the end of the relationship?

episodes.title: The Falcon and the D'ohman
episodes.description: Homer attempts to help a former CIA agent plagued by violent flashbacks from his past.

episodes.title: Bart Stops to Smell the Roosevelts
episodes.description: Superintendant Chalmers teaches Bart about Teddy Roosevelt after personally taking charge of the boy's education. When Chalmers loses his job, Bart and his classmates attempt to get him reinstated.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXII
episodes.description: In three terrifying Halloween tales... Homer discovers a unique way to communicate with his family; a spoof of 'Dexter' features Homer tricking Flanders; a spoof of the movie 'Avatar' features Bart as a tentacled alien.

episodes.title: Replaceable You
episodes.description: With some help from Martin Prince, Bart constructs cute, baby seal-like robots that rival Lisa's entry in a science fair project; Homer ends up working for his new assistant.

episodes.title: The Food Wife
episodes.description: As Homer and Marge vie for the kids' approval... Marge, Bart and Lisa become successful food bloggers; Homer finds himself trapped in a meth lab after Marge deliberately gives him the wrong address for a restaurant.

episodes.title: The Book Job
episodes.description: After Lisa discovers that her favorite author doesn't exist, Homer forms a literary gang in hopes of writing a bestselling "tween" novel and raking in millions.

episodes.title: The Man in the Blue Flannel Pants
episodes.description: Burns appoints Homer the nuclear power plant's new account man, damning him to a 'Mad Men'-like existence; Lisa becomes Bart's mentor.

episodes.title: The Ten-Per-Cent Solution
episodes.description: After being fired from his popular kids' show, Krusty stages a comeback with help from an agent who's also an old flame.

episodes.title: Holidays Of Future Passed
episodes.description: Thirty years in the future, Bart and Lisa attempt to bond with their children on Christmas; an unwed Maggie gives birth while heading home for the holidays.

episodes.title: Politically Inept, With Homer Simpson
episodes.description: Homer becomes a celebrity after he voices his conservative opinions on a cable talk show, and attempts to convince leaders of the Republican party to nominate singer Ted Nugent for president.

episodes.title: The D'oh-cial Network
episodes.description: Lisa's idea for an online social network becomes a tremendous hit, but so many people become addicted to posting on the site, it leads to chaos.

episodes.title: Moe Goes From Rags To Riches
episodes.description: Moe's bar rag tells the story of his existence; Milhouse tires of taking abuse from Bart.

episodes.title: The Daughter Also Rises
episodes.description: As Valentine's Day approaches, Marge grows concerned when Lisa finds a boyfriend; Bart and Milhouse set out on a 'mythbusting' mission at Springfield Elementary.

episodes.title: At Long Last Leave
episodes.description: Fed up with the family's negative impact on the city, townspeople banish the Simpsons from Springfield.

episodes.title: Exit Through The Kwik-E-Mart
episodes.description: Bart becomes a famous street artist after he plasters Springfield with unflattering graffiti of Homer's likeness; Apu panics when he's forced to compete with a friendly grocery store chain featuring a South Pacific motif.

episodes.title: How I Wet Your Mother
episodes.description: With help from one of Professor Frink's inventions, Marge and the kids enter Homer's dreams in hopes of curing him of incontinence.

episodes.title: Them, Robot
episodes.description: Homer becomes the last human employee at the nuclear power plant after Mr. Burns orders a mass firing and replaces staffers with robots.

episodes.title: Beware My Cheating Bart
episodes.description: Bart falls for Jimbo's girlfriend Shauna; Homer buys a tricked-out treadmill so he can watch old episodes of a 'Lost'-like television show.

episodes.title: A Totally Fun Thing Bart Will Never Do Again
episodes.description: The Simpsons vacation on a cruise liner, where Bart has so much fun he concocts a scheme to keep his family aboard the ship forever.

episodes.title: The Spy Who Learned Me
episodes.description: After being injured at work, Homer is given eight weeks of paid vacation, and decides to keep the news secret from his family; Bart gets Nelson hooked on Krustyburgers so he'll gain weight and stop picking on him.

episodes.title: Ned 'n Edna's Blend Agenda
episodes.description: Complications ensue when Flanders and Krabappel admit they're secretly married.

episodes.title: Lisa Goes Gaga
episodes.description: Singer Lady Gaga attempts to cheer Lisa after she's voted the most unpopular kid at school.

episodes.title: Moonshine River
episodes.description: Bart seeks out Cletus's daughter, who has started a new life in New York City, Lisa wants to take in a Broadway play but ends up performing Shakespeare in Central Park.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXIII
episodes.description: In these three Halloween tales... a black hole threatens to destroy Springfield; the Simpsons are terrorized by the unknown in a spoof of 'Paranormal Activity'; Bart time travels in a spoof of 'Back to the Future.'

episodes.title: Adventures in Baby-getting
episodes.description: Marge decides she wants to conceive another child; Bart realizes Lisa is up to something mysterious and vows to find out what it is.

episodes.title: Gone Abie Gone
episodes.description: Homer and Marge search for Grampa after he disappears from the retirement home; Homer invests Lisa's college fund in an online poker Web site.

episodes.title: Penny-Wiseguys
episodes.description: While serving jury duty, Fat Tony appoints an accountant as his temporary Don; an anemic Lisa eats bugs to increase her iron level.

episodes.title: A Tree Grows in Springfield
episodes.description: After his beloved new tablet "MyPad" computer is destroyed, a despondent Homer finds solace in a message seemingly written by God - until newsman Kent Brockman sets out to debunk the "miracle."

episodes.title: The Day the Earth Stood Cool
episodes.description: Homer is elated when a cool dad and his family move next door, but his happiness ends when he realizes he has little in common with his new neighbors.

episodes.title: To Cur, With Love
episodes.description: When Bart accuses Homer of not liking Santa's Little Helper, Grampa recounts the story of how Homer's heart broke after he was forced to give away his childhood dog.

episodes.title: Homer Goes to Prep School
episodes.description: The Simpsons anticipate the apocalypse after Homer inadvertently triggers a shockwave that disables all electronic devices in Springfield.

episodes.title: A Test Before Trying
episodes.description: Bart must pass a district-wide test to save Springfield Elementary; Homer uses a discarded parking meter to steal from unsuspecting drivers.

episodes.title: The Changing of the Guardian
episodes.description: After narrowly surviving a tornado, Marge and Homer embark on a search for a couple who'll serve as Bart, Lisa and Maggie's legal guardians.

episodes.title: Love is a Many-Splintered Thing
episodes.description: Bart attempts to patch things up with his old sweetheart, Mary Spuckler, and despite Lisa's input, still manages to sabotage his chances of finding love.

episodes.title: Hardly Kirk-ing
episodes.description: With Bart's help, Milhouse transforms into his father; Homer discovers a talent for finding things in hidden-picture books.

episodes.title: Gorgeous Grampa
episodes.description: With encouragement from Mr. Burns, Grampa revives a famous wrestling character from his past whom audiences love to hate, and despite Homer and Marge's objections, incorporates Bart into the act.

episodes.title: Black-Eyed, Please
episodes.description: When Flanders gives Homer a black eye, he turns to the Bible for answers; Lisa is shocked and puzzled when she discovers that a substitute teacher hates her.

episodes.title: Dark Knight Court
episodes.description: Bart stands trial in youth court after he's accused of pulling an Easter prank; after buying a comic book collection, Mr. Burns transforms into a 'Batman'-like superhero.

episodes.title: What Animated Women Want
episodes.description: In an episode that focuses on the choices people make and their outcomes... Homer attempts to save his marriage; Milhouse woos Lisa.

episodes.title: Pulpit Friction
episodes.description: Lovejoy quits the church after the Parson appoints a charismatic reverend to reinvigorate the parish; Marge tracks down her old wedding dress.

episodes.title: Whiskey Business
episodes.description: Moe's new suit catches the attention of venture capitalists, leading to the distribution of Moe's own brand of whiskey; Bart cares for Grampa; Lisa realizes that her favorite musicians have been turned into holograms.

episodes.title: The Fabulous Faker Boy
episodes.description: Bart takes piano lessons in hopes of impressing his beautiful young teacher; Homer goes completely bald; Marge teaches a Russian man how to drive.

episodes.title: The Saga of Carl
episodes.description: Homer, Moe and Lenny travel to Iceland to retrieve lottery winnings that Carl ran off with.

episodes.title: Dangers on a Train
episodes.description: Homer secretly reconstructs a kiddy train as Marge's anniversary present; Marge attracts the attention of a potential paramour online.

episodes.title: Homerland
episodes.description: When Homer returns from a Nuclear Workers Convention and begins behaving strangely, Lisa worries that her father has been brainwashed and is now part of a terrorist plot to blow up the power plant.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXIV
episodes.description: In three terrifying Halloween tales, Bart, Lisa and Maggie receive a visit from The Fat in the Hat; when Bart is decapitated, his head is sewn onto Lisa's body; Homer plots to kill Moe at a circus freak show.

episodes.title: Four Regrettings and a Funeral
episodes.description: A Springfield funeral prompts Marge, Kent Brockman, Homer and Mr. Burns to reexamine a crucial decision in their lives one that has brought them the most regret.

episodes.title: YOLO
episodes.description: After experiencing a midlife crisis, Homer reaches out to an old pen pal; when a cheating scandal rocks Springfield Elementary, Lisa establishes an honor code.

episodes.title: Labor Pains
episodes.description: Homer gets trapped in an elevator with a pregnant woman and helps deliver her baby; Lisa helps underpaid cheerleaders organize so they can demand a salary increase from a greedy football team owner.

episodes.title: The Kid Is All Right
episodes.description: Lisa is elated to befriend Isabel, a smart new student at school, only to realize that she and Isabel are on opposite sides of the political spectrum.

episodes.title: Yellow Subterfuge
episodes.description: Bart seeks revenge after Skinner prevents him from attending a school field trip aboard a submarine; Lisa suggests to the financially-strapped Krusty that he sell the foreign rights to his television show.

episodes.title: White Christmas Blues
episodes.description: As Christmas approaches, Marge transforms the house into a bed and breakfast after Springfield becomes the only town in America to receive snowfall; Lisa vows to give her loved ones modest gifts that come from the heart.

episodes.title: Steal This Episode
episodes.description: Homer is put on trial after the FBI catches him illegally downloading movies from the Internet.

episodes.title: Married to the Blob
episodes.description: The Comic Book Guy marries a Japanese woman, only to discover that the woman's father disapproves of the union.

episodes.title: Specs and the City
episodes.description: Homer uses augmented reality glasses to spy on Marge; Nelson demands a Valentine's Day card from Bart.

episodes.title: Diggs
episodes.description: Bart befriends a fellow student and falconry expert, only to discover that the boy suffers from mental illness.

episodes.title: The Man Who Grew Too Much
episodes.description: Sideshow Bob genetically alters his DNA, giving him superhuman strength; Marge volunteers as a teen abstinence counselor.

episodes.title: The Winter of His Content
episodes.description: When the Simpsons allow members of the retirement community to move in with them, Marge worries that Homer is picking up their habits and is turning into an old man; a gang of bullies accepts Bart as one of their own.

episodes.title: The War of Art
episodes.description: Homer convinces Marge to sell a painting that was purchased from Milhouse's parents at a yard sale, a painting that turns out to be worth a great deal of money.

episodes.title: You Don't Have to Live Like a Referee
episodes.description: After Lisa delivers a school report on why her father is her hero, Homer is tapped to referee World Cup soccer in Brazil.

episodes.title: Luca$
episodes.description: Lisa falls for a competitive eater who subconsciously reminds her of Homer; after Bart hides Jailbird from the police, he begins receiving stolen gifts.

episodes.title: Days of Future Future
episodes.description: Thirty years in the future, Bart tries to reestablish his relationship with his estranged wife, Jenda; Lisa thinks Milhouse is far more interesting after he's bitten by a zombie.

episodes.title: What to Expect When Bart's Expecting
episodes.description: Bart uses voodoo in an attempt to get rid of an art teacher, but when the teacher ends up getting pregnant, word spreads that Bart can help couples conceive.

episodes.title: Brick Like Me
episodes.description: After Homer bonds with Lisa, Homer's imagination creates a world in which everything is made of Lego toys.

episodes.title: Pay Pal
episodes.description: As Mother's Day approaches, after Homer and Marge's attempt to befriend other couples fails miserably, Lisa discovers a shocking secret about her new best friend.

episodes.title: Yellow Badge of Cowardge
episodes.description: Bart is overcome with guilt after an act of cowardice leads to his winning a school race; Homer vows to hold his own Fourth of July fireworks display after Springfield's holiday celebration is canceled.

episodes.title: The Longest Daycare
episodes.description: A theatrical short that premiered July 13, 2012, attached to the theatrical release of Ice Age: Continental Drift.  It was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Animated Short.

episodes.title: Clown in the Dumps
episodes.description: The unthinkable happens: a Springfield resident dies.

episodes.title: The Wreck of the Relationship
episodes.description: Homer and Bart set sail on the relation ship.

episodes.title: Super Franchise Me
episodes.description: Marge opens a sandwich shop.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXV
episodes.description: Don't miss the all-new, spooktacular Halloween special, "Treehouse of Horror XXV."

episodes.title: Opposites-A-Frack
episodes.description: An all-new episode featuring guest voice Jane Fonda, whose character falls for Mr. Burns.

episodes.title: Simpsorama
episodes.description: The Simpsons travel to the 31st century.

episodes.title: Blazed and Confused
episodes.description: Bart faces a tough test at school when he gets a new teacher, Mr. Lassen, who vows to crush his spirit.

episodes.title: Covercraft
episodes.description: Homer forms a cover band with some of the other dads in town.

episodes.title: I Won't Be Home For Christmas
episodes.description: Marge doesn't approve of Homer's Christmas spirits.

episodes.title: The Man Who Came To Be Dinner
episodes.description: An amusement park ride lands the Simpsons in outer space..

episodes.title: Bart's New Friend
episodes.description: Bart and Homer become BFF's.

episodes.title: The Musk Who Fell to Earth
episodes.description: Homer becomes muse to Elon Musk.

episodes.title: Walking Big and Tall
episodes.description: Springfield gets a new town anthem.

episodes.title: My Fare Lady
episodes.description: Marge trades in her mom-chauffeur hat for a real one.

episodes.title: The Princess Guide
episodes.description: Moe plots revenge over Nigerian e-mail scam.

episodes.title: Sky Police
episodes.description: The Springfield congregation turns to gambling to repair the church.

episodes.title: Waiting for Duffman
episodes.description: When Duffman undergoes hip replacement surgery and retires, the company sets up a reality show competition to find his replacement.

episodes.title: Peeping Mom
episodes.description: Bart lies about being involved in a bulldozer crash, so Marge decides to follow him everywhere until he confesses.

episodes.title: The Kids Are All Fight
episodes.description: When Homer gets an old film roll developed, the family takes a trip down memory lane to see the origins of how Bart and Lisa first started fighting with each other.

episodes.title: Let's Go Fly A Coot
episodes.description: The Simpsons learn about Grampa's days in the Air Force, and Bart takes up smoking to impress Milhouse's Dutch cousin.

episodes.title: Bull-E
episodes.description: After Bart gets bullied at the school dance, Marge convinces the town to pass anti-bullying legislation.

episodes.title: Mathlete's Feat
episodes.description: When a modernized Springfield Elementary has a technical meltdown, Lisa transforms it into a Waldorf school.

episodes.title: Every Man's Dream
episodes.description: Marge decides it's finally time to separate from Homer, and quickly moves on with her life. Homer is initially devastated, but soon stumbles into a romance with a younger woman.

episodes.title: Cue Detective
episodes.description: A celebrity television chef challenges Homer to a barbecue cook-off. But before the competition, Homer's new, prized barbecue grill is stolen.

episodes.title: Puffless
episodes.description: Patty and Selma try to quit smoking, but Patty moves in with the Simpsons when Selma takes it up again. Meanwhile, Maggie goes on an adventure with some local creatures.

episodes.title: Halloween of Horror
episodes.description: The Simpsons are proud to be the most festively decorated house on the block. But when Lisa is traumatized at Krustyland Horror Night, she feels she cannot handle Halloween anymore.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXVI
episodes.description: After killing Bart, Sideshow Bob doesn't know what to do with himself; Homer wakes up with short-term memory loss; Because of radiation, Lisa, Bart and Milhouse gain super-powers.

episodes.title: Friend with Benefit
episodes.description: Lisa makes a new friend at school - Harper, who happens to be super-rich, while Homer makes friends with Harper's dad and sets out to continue living the good life when Lisa decides to end the friendship.

episodes.title: Lisa with an 'S'
episodes.description: Broadway legend Laney Fontaine transforms Lisa into a show-biz kid after Homer loses her chance at band camp.

episodes.title: Paths of Glory
episodes.description: Lisa tries to restore the reputation of a forgotten Springfield female inventor, while Bart takes full advantage of a diagnosis that he is a sociopath.

episodes.title: Barthood
episodes.description: A tale of Bart's journey from youth to adulthood, where he is constantly in search of approval from his father and in the shadow of his more-successful younger sister.

episodes.title: The Girl Code
episodes.description: When Homer loses his job due to Marge's social media post, he begins working as a dishwasher at a Greek restaurant. Meanwhile, Lisa creates an app that can predict the effect any post on social media will have.

episodes.title: Teenage Mutant Milk-Caused Hurdles
episodes.description: Bart and Principal Skinner battle over the affection of Bart's new teacher, and a new milk-based product that Homer buys from the Kwik-E-Mart causes big changes in Bart and Lisa.

episodes.title: Much Apu About Something
episodes.description: Apu's nephew makes big changes when he takes over the Kwik-E-Mart business, and Bart decides that he's through with being bad after his latest prank spirals out of control.

episodes.title: Love Is in the N2-O2-Ar-CO2-Ne-He-CH4
episodes.description: Professor Frink's new invention turns him into a ladies' man, while a new pill at the Springfield Retirement Castle causes Grandpa to hallucinate back to his happiest moments.

episodes.title: Gal of Constant Sorrow
episodes.description: Lisa tries to launch the career of a homeless Appalachian folk singer, but Bart warns her that she will just let her down. Meanwhile, Homer tries to rescue the cat, who is trapped in the walls of the house.

episodes.title: Lisa the Veterinarian
episodes.description: Lisa takes a job as veterinarian's assistant, but soon lets the responsibilities of the job get to her head. Meanwhile, Marge decides to take a job as a crime scene cleaner.

episodes.title: The Marge-ian Chronicles
episodes.description: Lisa signs up for an opportunity to be part of a mission to colonize Mars in ten years, and Homer's strategy to use reverse psychology to talk her out of it backfires.

episodes.title: The Burns Cage
episodes.description: Homer tries to raise Smithers' spirits by finding him a man, and Lisa gets the lead in the school production of "Casablanca" alongside a new male student, sparking Millhouse's jealousy.

episodes.title: How Lisa Got Her Marge Back
episodes.description: After Lisa overhears Marge say that she doesn't like Lisa's jazz music, Marge takes Lisa on a trip to Capitol City to regain her friendship. Meanwhile, Bart uses Maggie as his new partner in crime for his practical jokes.

episodes.title: Fland Canyon
episodes.description: Maggie will not go to sleep, so Homer tells her a bedtime story about when the Simpsons and the Flanders went together to the Grand Canyon.

episodes.title: To Courier with Love
episodes.description: After promising Marge the trip of a lifetime, Homer makes a deal with a travel agent to be a courier of a top-secret briefcase in exchange for a discounted family vacation to Paris.

episodes.title: Simprovised
episodes.description: While trying to overcome a fear of public speaking, Homer creates an improv comedy troupe. Meanwhile, Marge rebuilds Bart's treehouse, but gets no thanks from him. Homer later appears live to answer phoned in questions.

episodes.title: Orange Is the New Yellow
episodes.description: Marge lets Bart go to the park alone because he's too irritating, then she ends up getting arrested for leaving him unsupervised.

episodes.title: Monty Burns' Fleeing Circus
episodes.description: Mr. Burns puts on a variety show at the Springfield Bowl.

episodes.title: Friends and Family
episodes.description: Homer finds a new friend in a woman who acts just like him when Mr. Burns hires the other Simpsons as his live-in virtual reality family.

episodes.title: The Town
episodes.description: Homer takes the family on a "hate-cation" to Boston after he catches Bart rooting for a rival football team.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXVII
episodes.description: The children of Springfield fight to the death, Hunger Games style; Lisa's imaginary friend kills her real friends; Moe recruits Bart into his group of covert barfly agents.

episodes.title: Trust but Clarify
episodes.description: Bart and Lisa investigate Krusty's new candy; Marge helps Homer dress for a promotion; Kent Brockman struggles with the changing media world.

episodes.title: There Will Be Buds
episodes.description: Homer coaches the kids' lacrosse team with Kirk Van Houten, who disappears before the championship game, after Homer rants about him being a loser.

episodes.title: Havana Wild Weekend
episodes.description: The Simpsons go to Cuba to get Grampa cheap medical care when the Retirement Castle and V.A. hospital are unable to solve his health problems.

episodes.title: Dad Behavior
episodes.description: Homer discovers an app that makes his life easier, while Grampa learns that he'll be a father again.

episodes.title: The Last Traction Hero
episodes.description: Homer is placed in a cast following a workplace accident, leading Marge to receive romance from an unexpected source; Lisa attempts to keep the peace as bus monitor.

episodes.title: The Nightmare After Krustmas
episodes.description: Krusty and his daughter spend Christmas with the Simpsons; Reverend Lovejoy seeks converts to boost attendance at church; A Christmas toy scares Maggie.

episodes.title: Pork and Burns
episodes.description: A Japanese book on minimalism inspires Marge to adapt to a new way of living, so the Simpsons have to part with items that no longer bring them joy.

episodes.title: Fatzcarraldo
episodes.description: When all the fast food restaurants in Springfield become healthy, Homer turns to the last bastion of greasy food for comfort; Lisa must find a good news story when her school radio station is in jeopardy.

episodes.title: The Cad and the Hat
episodes.description: Bart deals with his guilt of betraying Lisa; Homer is revealed to be a master chess player.

episodes.title: Kamp Krustier
episodes.description: Bart and Lisa return home following a traumatic incident at Kamp Krusty, putting an end to Homer and Marge's sexual encounters.

episodes.title: 22 for 30
episodes.description: Bart becomes a star basketball player at Springfield Elementary.

episodes.title: A Father's Watch
episodes.description: As Homer and Marge try a different parenting style on Bart, Grampa gives him a special watch.

episodes.title: The Caper Chase
episodes.description: Mr. Burns starts his own for-profit university and hires Homer as a professor.

episodes.title: Looking for Mr. Goodbart
episodes.description: Bart befriends the grandmothers of Springfield.

episodes.title: Moho House
episodes.description: Moe helps Homer and Marge work on their marriage.

episodes.title: Dogtown
episodes.description: The dogs of Springfield assert their dominance.

episodes.title: The Great Phatsby Parts 1 & 2
episodes.description: Mr. Burns tries to relive his glory days, and crosses paths with a mysterious music mogul. After being conned by him and reduced to bankruptcy, Mr. Burns seeks revenge on the music producer.

episodes.title: The Serfsons
episodes.description: In a world of magic, Marge's mother is transformed into an Ice Walker and must rely on Lisa to use magic to help Homer afford the cure.

episodes.title: Springfield Splendor
episodes.description: Marge and Lisa decide to turns an unpleasant experience Lisa had into a successful graphic novel.

episodes.title: Whistler's Father
episodes.description: Homer stumbles upon Maggie's incredible talent for whistling and decides to start her on the path to becoming a baby celebrity.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXVIII
episodes.description: Maggie's body is overwhelmed by the malice of an ancient demon; in an alternate dimension, Lisa stumbles upon a disturbingly perfect version of her family.

episodes.title: Grampy Can Ya Hear Me
episodes.description: Grampa Simpson is finally able to hear the various things that people say about him after he receives a new hearing aid.

episodes.title: The Old Blue Mayor She Ain't What She Used to Be
episodes.description: Marge decides to enter the race to become the next mayor of Springfield as she grows increasingly frustrated with how the local government operates.

episodes.title: Singin' in the Lane
episodes.description: Homer and the guys try helping Moe cheer up by getting their old bowling team back together again, but they soon face a team of arrogant millionaires.

episodes.title: Mr. Lisa's Opus
episodes.description: In the future, Lisa works on writing her Harvard college application essay by reflecting on how certain disappointing birthdays made her who she is.

episodes.title: Gone Boy
episodes.description: When Bart suddenly disappears, the town organizes a search party in the hopes of finding him.

episodes.title: Haw-Haw Land
episodes.description: While the Simpson family attends a STEM conference, Lisa becomes attracted to a pianist and Bart learns about his natural talent for chemistry.

episodes.title: Fink Gets Testy
episodes.description: When Mr. Burns begins to worry that the world is coming to an end, he starts testing all of the residents of to figure out who would be worth saving.

episodes.title: Homer Is Where the Art Isn't
episodes.description: Homer learns to love a piece of art.

episodes.title: 3 Scenes Plus a Tag from a Marriage
episodes.description: The Simpsons visit their old apartment and remember the days without their kids.

episodes.title: Fears of a Clown
episodes.description: Due to a general fear of clowns, Krusty can no longer do his job.

episodes.title: No Good Read Goes Unpunished
episodes.description: Bart tries to conquer Homer with help from a book.

episodes.title: King Leer
episodes.description: Moe inherits a mattress business from his father.

episodes.title: Lisa Gets the Blues
episodes.description: The family goes to New Orleans where they try to recover from various traumas.

episodes.title: Forgive and Regret
episodes.description: Grampa is about to die when he reveals a terrible secret.

episodes.title: Left Behind
episodes.description: Flanders loses his business and works with Homer at the plant.

episodes.title: Throw Grampa from the Dane
episodes.description: The Simpsons visit Denmark and everyone but Homer falls in love with the happy country.

episodes.title: Flanders' Ladder
episodes.description: Bart is struck by lightning and has horrible dreams.

episodes.title: Bart's Not Dead
episodes.description: Bart's cover for his lie backfires.

episodes.title: Heartbreak Hotel
episodes.description: Homer and Marge go on an amazing race type show where they are eliminated immediately.

episodes.title: My Way or the Highway to Heaven
episodes.description: The Simpsons explore three ways to get into heaven.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXIX
episodes.description: The Simpsons battle spores from space and Grampa goes to a Jurassic Park-style senior home.

episodes.title: Baby You Can't Drive My Car
episodes.description: Marge and Homer work together at a cool tech company.

episodes.title: From Russia Without Love
episodes.description: Bart orders a Russian bride for Moe. She turns Moe's life around, and he falls in love.

episodes.title: Werking Mom
episodes.description: Marge becomes a successful Tupperware saleswoman because customers think she's a man in drag.

episodes.title: Krusty the Clown
episodes.description: Homer becomes an internet recapper while Krusty joins the circus.

episodes.title: Daddicus Finch
episodes.description: Lisa reads "To Kill a Mockingbird" and observes similarities between her dad and Atticus Finch.

episodes.title: 'Tis the 30th Season
episodes.description: The Simpsons try to spend a relaxing Florida Christmas.

episodes.title: Mad About the Toy
episodes.description: Grampa learns a startling secret from his past. It takes him to Texas to find a long-lost life.

episodes.title: The Girl on the Bus
episodes.description: Lisa discovers the ideal family... and lies about her own.

episodes.title: I'm Dancing as Fat as I Can
episodes.description: When Homer breaks a promise and binge watches a show without Marge, she is more furious than ever.

episodes.title: The Clown Stays in the Picture
episodes.description: On a podcast Krusty discusses a lost film he made in the ‘80s.

episodes.title: 101 Mitigations
episodes.description: Homer goes on a joyride and is threatened with prison by Comic Book Guy.

episodes.title: I Want You (She's So Heavy)
episodes.description: Homer gets an inguinal hernia which comes to life and tells him to take it easy.

episodes.title: E My Sports
episodes.description: Bart earns money in a video game competition, and Homer becomes his coach.

episodes.title: Bart vs. Itchy and Scratchy
episodes.description: Bart is upset to learn there is a new, all-girl version of Itchy and Scratchy.

episodes.title: Girl's in the Band
episodes.description: Lisa joins an advanced youth orchestra in Capital City, throwing the family’s lives into havoc.

episodes.title: I'm Just a Girl Who Can't Say D'oh
episodes.description: Marge becomes director of a local theater production.

episodes.title: D'oh Canada
episodes.description: Lisa goes to Canada and refuses to leave. A desperate Marge tries to get her back.

episodes.title: Woo-Hoo Dunnit?
